One of the worst movies I've seen in a long time. Bad actors, bad story, stupid plot twists, bad dialogue, nothing makes sense.
There wasn't a single moment I was scared.
It could be a dark comedy but it isnt, it's just stupid beyond belief.

Review title: A unique and original story that's fun to watch
Review_body: First of all, I wish this film was a bit longer. The film is one hour and thirty-five minutes, with credits, and I feel like if it was longer it would have helped it out a bit more. This is a slight spoiler but it's the opening scene so either skip over this or read it but the film just jumps straight into the film. There is no lead up into it, it just jumps right in so not till later in the film do we learn why they are doing this. So, I feel like a couple of extra minutes in this film could have helped it out. The acting starts out cheesy and kind of annoying but as the film goes on and the stakes get higher it takes a sharp turn and becomes pretty good. As the movie progresses you get to see which family members are fully invested into this and which ones would rather not do it. I will say that Grace is one of the most badass characters in horror and I was always cheering her on. I will say the editing in the film is kind of award at times and makes no sense. I say sometimes because most of the time it's edited just fine but in a couple of scenes it just jumps to a scene that isn't connected and almost feels like the directors were like, "Shoot we forgot that one scene well let's just throw it in between these two scenes even though it doesn't make any sense to." This film is a horror-comedy and I will say they balance the two well and a couple of scenes had me chuckling. The last thing I want to mention is the score by Brian Tyler is great. In the end, I highly recommend checking out this film at least once because it's a unique and original story and we don't have a lot of that now a day.

Review title: Good humorous horror that helps promote our left wing agenda
Review_body: The movie had action, a bit of humor, lots of killing and blood, and also helped promote our left wing agenda that all rich people are evil and have sold their soul to the devil. They even say that many times throughout, that rich people suck, rich people are evil, etc. Good. We need to push this idea as much as possible to help bring down capitalism. All rich people are evil.....unless they are celebrities or athletes, of course. Then they are noble. Or if they are a socialist who made his millions from a book deal. Then that's ok. Or if they are a left wing politician...they are noble too. Yeah, but the rest, evil.

Review title: Stay clear of this ketchup production.
Review_body: You heard it. Lots of ketchup. That kind of movie I really don't understand how people actually enjoy to watch. Obvious script, cliché up to the neck and lots and lots of fake blood. Not to mention dark, low lit scenes. Go watch something else instead of this crap.

Review title: A movie about appreciating the in-laws you have.
Review_body: Ready Or Not reminded me of a favorite movie from my childhood, Clue, a black comedy-mystery that was based on a very popular board game of the same name. The first thing that you will probably notice with Ready Or Not is that it has a personality. The mansion, the lighting, even the cast of kooky characters. Props to the casting director as everyone was well-casted, with Samara Weaving leading the charge and it was nice to see Adam Brody again. We should see more of him, I think he has shaken off THE OC dust bunnies at this point.There was no plan for me to watch Ready Or Not anytime soon but it kept popping up in different lists of movies to watch and there must be something to it if it keeps showing up way past its promotion period. Speaking of which, the trailer did not do the movie justice. The impression I got from watching the trailer was that it was a B-movie, and with a budget of $6million maybe it was. But being able to recuperate its budget on its first day of showing should be enough to change your mind.The movie for me felt short even with a running time of 1h and 35m. You know what they say when you're doing something and time flies by: "You're having fun." They could've stretched the movie a little more if they showed the drawing of cards of the other outsiders, Becky, Charity, and Fitch during their time. It could've added to the comic relief (I wonder how disappointed they were when Fitch drew a normal card) or trepidation when we pan back to Grace's turn. Now the denouement is where it gets tricky. While the movie received mostly positive reviews, there are those with mixed reactions because they felt the ending was kinda campy and somewhat a letdown. I mean I was glued to the screen from the beginning until the last 10 minutes because everything was hinged on the possibility of it happening in real life, then the ending came. I won't ruin it for you, but it's not for everyone. Some will like it, others might not. My proposed alternate ending would've been: they paid her a huge sum amount of money, sign an NDA and let her go. Then the rest died mysteriously based on the concept of the numerous board games the family dominion came up with. Sort of like a Final Destination montage. Then we go back to her reading of the family's misfortune all the way in Boracay, the sipping from her buco juice. Here's hoping we get a prequel.

Funny concept but horribly annoyingly over the top characters. Didnt hate it but didnt love it. With Horror becoming a big money maker anymore there is gonna be a lot of either garbage, avg, or really good horror movies coming out... But I havent seen a good genre film since 2015. Hopefully someone pulls their own money into something good because these filmmakers/writers theyre pulling arent brian de palmas.

Review title: The stupidest, lamest, most illogical movie EVER
Review_body: To me that was not even funny or entertaining - it was just written, directed and acted from amateurs or at least this is how it felt. I cannot believe I watched it to the end so I saw the lamest horrible ending.

Review title: Good players are hard to find.
Review_body: The Le Domas' have an interesting family history, their ancestor made a deal with a man named Le Bail(French for a Lease if you want a bit of trivia and Le Domas means thought - my Google translate is working overtime today), their family fortune developed from that moment, however, as with all dodgy deals with people you don't know who promise you riches, there is a catch! Every time one of the family marries, they all sit around and the new Le Domas, selects a card with a game on it.Now this card selection, often leads to fin and games and a wedding night to remember, however, ever so often someone pulls out the 'Hide and Seek' card and then what should be for the happy couple a night to remember, becomes a night one part will never forget and the other part, well they won't have the chance to forget!And to this warped family, comes Grace (Samara Weaving), the new wife of Alex (Mark O'Brien), poor Grace, selects the one card that causes problems and the fun and games begin. To be honest, most of the family take more than a little bit of enjoyment from hunting the poor woman and taking pot shots at her. However, she does have the occasional bit of help from some unlikely quarters.Samara Weaving is superb as Grace, portraying her fear, shock and ultimately her feck you attitude. She is the heroine you root for and you quickly turn against the family to support her. Adam Brody as alcoholic brother Daniel is fantastic and his vulnerability and torn relationships are a nice contrast to his bloodthirsty wife Charity (Elyse Levesque), who you cannot help but feel, if she pulled the Hide and Seek card, things would've been a whole lot bloodier, a whole lot quicker and brother in law Bradley (Kristian Bruun) who loves the family money but is a little bit more choosy and his instrument of death. Both Miss Levesque and Mr Bruun create very fun and watchable characters who add to the horror and fun. You also have Andie MacDowell, as the matriarch of the family who just wants to protect her brood.The film is fast, fun and bloody, you really wouldn't want to be a maid at this party - the tips you receive are on the end of a crossbow blot! There are a few queasy moments, a nail at the top of a ladder springs to mind and there's some awesome death scenes. A really fresh idea as well, which in the time of remakes and sequels is really refreshing, a hide behind your hands and count to 17/20.

Imagine if living in a wealthy family that enjoys killing as game. Well this it. These people are crazy. They have to play a game to survive the curse at dawn. It began as a very serious scary movie that changed to a very campy goofy ending. I liked the direction of the movie when it started but I felt that it lost some by the comical aspect. Very bad ending.

I'll preface by saying I have a dark sense of humor. Oddly, I correctly foreshadowed all the staff dying, which was amusing. I had a feeling the house would burn down. I was really rooting for Alex, but then I was ready for him to die when he switched. I figured the family was just crazy, but then the blood rituals with goats were mentioned and I knew what they were trying to do. The decision to make it a real thing at the end was great! I really enjoyed this movie.

Review title: It will keep your eyes on screen!
Review_body: Grace is about to marry the youngest member of the very wealthy Le Domas family. But there's something sinister going on with this family... Well, the movie's central idea is not that new but the delivery of the idea, the pace and the performance of Samara Weaving really elevate this film. Entertaining and tense with comical moments that fit the genre, will make you follow almost all the characters in the film. Also kudos to the slow costume transformation of the bride and the juxtaposition of the prior wedding shots with what happens after, as this helps create a sense of relatability with Grace.One of the entertaining movies of 2019.8/10.

Ready or Not seems like a cheesy horror movie when you first hear of it but when you go to actually see it, you are in for a badass horror/comedy movie that will leave you on the edge of your seat every single second. Ready or Not was not only an one-of-a-kind horror experience but it also had a powerful and badass female lead which made this movie even more enjoyable. Combine that with all the blood and guts in this movie, you get one hell of a horror film for the new generation. So worth the money and so one I plan on seeing over and over again.

I came to a big big question after watching about half of the movie: "Is it a point-n-shoot game or is it Ritual?" You caught her n u could readily kill her right there. And that should be the end of the story. But then u brought her back for a time-consuming ritual? Hell yeah then u gave her plenty of time n chances to change her fate. I really can't come to a clue.But other than this big plot hole, I quite enjoy the dark comedy and the thriller atmosphere of the whole movie. It won't make my heart beats faster, and it won't stun my brain for even once, but I love the dark, strange and survival horror in a combination.I would recommend it if you have free Friday night for it.

I had a good time with this movie. I was getting strong The Cabin In The Woods vibes. In some ways the premise is very similar in the uniqueness of what the story was and how really simple the idea is. Here we basically have a game of literal Hide and Seek to the point of saving the family from death of a deal brokered many years before. Execute the bride to save them. Cabin in the Woods; execute certain people to appease a god so the world won't end. Now I know it may sound nothing alike but if you just break it down to the simplest story; they are alike.

Brilliantly dumb fun movie with weird characters and a plot that are fun to watch act and unfold it's really violent but not in a horror way in more of a comic way which is where the movie slips up it's a bit intense every now and then but it's not horror and not really comical enough like Tucker and Dale vs evil to be a horror parody it's kind of in that slasher movie middle ground were it doesn't know whether to be comedy, action or horror.If you want true substance in any way not the movie for you but if you want dumb stupid stuff for an HR or so this is the movie for you the characters are a laugh and the plot is insane af in a fun way.

At the beginning I thought, all right, I'll take a look and expect the worst. But the quality of the film quickly becomes clear through the good actors. And when the game of hide and seek begins, the light humour of the introduction also makes sense. I'm not a fan of violent excesses, but the voluntary and involuntary murders in "Ready or Not" are absolutely hilarious. And when the supposed superstition turns out to be fact at the end, it's a pleasant surprise, as is the whole film, which for the first time after "Braindead" mixes horror and humour into an excellent cocktail.

Review title: An Engaging and Submersive Horror Comedy.
Review_body:
READY OR NOT (2019) REVIEW
.
.
📜 Plot: A young lady named Grace (Samara Weaving) gets married to the love of her life and finally arrives at his palatial ancestral home to meet the family, but just when the meet-and-greet turns festive, she realizes that the family is involved in murderous hunting games, and that she's the prey.
.
.
👨‍⚖️ Review : Directed by Matt Bettinelli-Olpin and Tyler Gillett , this horror comedy is a slick entertainer. The premise is fresh, unique and gradually developing intriguing screenplay packs a punch. The film keeps you engaged even if the entire movie is shot inside a mansion with a psycho family running around to kill a girl. The dark and gruesome humour is a plus point of this very tightly edited movie.Samara Weaving is brilliant , she plays the bold character of Grace who rather being a damsel in distress , fiercely attends the situation to escape the environment. The Other Characters are extremely funny and have done great work.Overall , this slasher horror movie is a fun and entertaining ride which gives you chills and laughs while being Dark and Deadly at the same time. An absurd family, a cruel game and a newly wedded girl in distress all in all makes this one a worthy watch.
.
.
👍Goods :
1.Samara Weaving's Rock Solid Act
2. Intriguing Premise and fresh take on Horror Comedy
3. Tightly Edited Screenplay
.
.
👎 Bads :
1. Too much bloodshed so definitely not a family movie.
.
.
🔥 Final Rating : 7.5/10
.
.
✅ Verdict : Ready or Not shifts from being a bloody hilarious state to entirely bloody state. With a fresh take of horror along with comedy this one is a worthy watch.
.
.
Follow in Instagram for More : @RiteshReviews

A truly delirious delight And you don't need to be a genre obsessive to appreciate. Sure there are gruesome moments but the pleasure is in the mostly comedic performances. If it strives toward some satirical idea, it's subtle enough. This isn't trying to be Get Out. It knows it isn't. It's big dumb fun and that's fine. The crazy ending sticks the landing as well.

The truth about old money, the filthy rich, exposed with emotional honesty and fine cinematography. They are all bush-league Satanists. Samara Weaving's acting was so solid and on-point, I thought she was Margot Robbie for the first 45 minutes or so. The theory of why folks sometimes spontaneously combust is finally revealed in all of its perturbing and sanguine grandeur. More dark humor than a Cure album, too. Pretty cool seeing that dude from Sledgehammer again, as well. He didn't blow up the world this time (oops, was that a spoiler?).

Ready or Not has one of the most preposterous plots I've ever encountered. Thankfully, the cast and crew are up to the challenge of making the preposterous glorious.Grace (Samara Weaving) is getting married to handsome Alex. He's avoided his family for years, but now that he's getting married, tradition dictates he introduce his bride incumbent to the family (including Adam Brody as Grace's new BIL, and the fabulous Andie MacDowell as the matriarch). They're rich. They're really rich. They're also very sweet, if a little odd. Oddest of all is the fact that after the wedding, the family gathers to play a game. The game will be randomly selected and choices include "Old Maid" and "Hide and Seek" wherein the family will hunt the newly wed down and kill her. Guess which one Grace picks?No one is thrilled at the thought but tradition must be adhered to. Thankfully for Grace, the family hasn't had to kill anyone in generations and their weapons are all from the dark ages. Not to mention, the dynasty has come apart over the decades as the family wealth stagnated any development of the children, resulting in almost all family members being completely inept at the most basic task. Scenes of family members trying to operate crossbows, hunting rifles and even just swinging axes prove to be hilarious. Grace, thinking it's an actual game at first, provides a brilliant source of laughter and tension as she cartoonishly tip toes around looking for a hiding space while family members run rampant, trying to kill her.Besides the fun to be had at watching the Bluth family try to kill an incredulous Buffy Summers (without the superpowers), the film has a lot to say about the nature of tradition for tradition's sake, dynasty and wealth and who really deserves it. Especially poignant for our times when our leaders who have over generations gone to seed, carried to power by the nefarious (perhaps sometimes noble) efforts of their ancestors, are proving to be in need of a cleaning out. In one moment, clad in fighting gear, looking the picture of the revolution in her bloodied wedding dress, Grace doesn't strike a powerful pose for women or the underclass, instead she visibly flinches and balks, shoulders drooping, uncomfortably despairing at what's happened. It's a great, quiet moment in a great, loud movie.

Marriage is a real fight in life. It's more than just love and passion. (Especially for Chinese multi generation family.)Your marriage life would be miserable if you ignore his background and his family. Your life will be no better than playing the "hide and seek" with his weird lifestyle, nonsense family rules and mean relatives, there's countless guns and arrows will make you either surrendered or run for escape.The mother-in-law said she like you, but she would also harm you easily. Don't fight with your mother-in-law. Your husband might fall for you when you're in an disadvantage position. Men would promise you everything when he's in love. But he would also turn against you when you're not in his interest.He sweared, you're everything to him, he would die if you're gone.
Ironically, he was the one who put you to death in a marriage. You have to use your full strength to dodge the knives from your ex.Finally when sun began to rise, and marriage came to the end, your former lover turned back into a (hypocrite) gentleman and ask for your forgiveness. Every woman probably want to have a super power to blast him to death.So girls, are you ready or not?

Funny, superbly acted and well crafted, Ready or Not is an enjoyable dark comedy diversion, though it has no business being rated 18. Apart from a literal explosive ending, the rest of the movie floats by with a soft 15 rating at least, where most the violence is suggested or entirely cut away from. A few cuts and slashes here and there, but nothing that grisly. John Wick 3, somehow, is a 15, that has more eye-wincing violence and gore in its first 15 minutes than this entire 18 rated movie, so I was letdown in this department, considering that everyone is calling it a total gorefest, but hey it's still an entertaining enough flick.

Review title: Ready Or Not Film Review - Matt Bettinelli-Olpin & Tyler Gillett Direct Samara Weaving's Bride & Seek Massacre Among The Dumbwaiters & Dead Maids
Review_body: Directed by Matt Bettinelli-Olpin & Tyler Gillett, Ready Or Not opens 30 years earlier with a terrified groom looking for somewhere to hide. With great frantic photography by Brett Jutkiewicz. Given away by young Daniel, he is shot and dragged off. But the film's not just a film about the rich hunting the poor, it just so happens that present day new bride Samara Weaving's Grace is poor. She could have easily been a rich girl and fallen in love with Mark O'Brien's Alex. Looking for a Happy Family finally to belong to. Not their riches.But as Grace is poor her new husband's family believe her to be a gold-digger. For this is the Le Domas dominion, one of the most illustrious families in America, having made their money in board games. Scratch Cluedo and Scrabble for best sellers such as Family Ritual and Survive. This is an 18 after all! But anyone can tell you that Monopoly can get quite heated, Mayfair trumps Old Kent Road, just as the board goes over.After staring down the new in-laws , Grace makes it through her nice day for a white wedding day. Nicky Guadagni is a terrific Aunt Helena, she'll look great with a Grim Reaper's axe at Halloween! It was her husband shot those 30 long years ago. No wonder she seems scary. And as she appears in Grace and Alex's room that evening she suggests that Grace will have to be better at hiding. Because the wheeze of this family is that when a new member joins, they have to play a game.Turns out family legend tells of old man Le Domas meeting a traveller back in the days of the Civil War, and receiving a box in exchange for promising to make his gaming fortune. The stipulation that every new member must play the game on their wedding night. As family members arrive to play, the evening seem harmless enough, What's Old Maid? asks fish out of water Kristian Bruun's Fitch. That was the game he had to play when he married Alex's sister Emilie. Well Grace is ready to backgammon the hell out of them.Nervous anticipation round the room at midnight, and then deathly silence, as Grace pulls Hide & Seek out of the box. Of all the games in all the world. But game as she is Grace goes off to hide in the dumbwaiter. Just how a bride wants to spend her wedding night she muses. As the Le Domas family arm themselves with weapons of Grace destruction. Don't let Melanie Scrofano's Emilie near the gun. She's a complete coke head!Bridegroom Alex is in shock, in playing Hide & Seek the family must kill the new family member before dawn. But determined to save Grace he grabs her as they hide in the bedroom, just as a maid comes in. And Emilie thinking she's found Grace rushes in after her, and shoots her in the head. I told you! We're hunting the blonde in the wedding dress! So heads or tails! As Grace realises that this hide and seek may not turn out well for her. Alex explains he didn't tell her before they married because she wouldn't have married him. You think. But the chance of Grace getting the Hide and Seek card....So run rabbit run rabbit run run run as Alex's parents played by Andie MacDowell and Henry Czerny round up the family. It's a hunt to the death. And they're having a blast, even if they're a bit rusty at it. And those weapons are antiques. They don't come with player instructions.Alex's brother Daniel finds Grace in the library, a Cluedo favourite, he'll give her a 100 start. A bit lax with his counting though. Adam Brody's Daniel is tired of the family games, but his wife Charity, played with little, by Elyse Levesque, is blood thirsty. Anyone would think the Hounds of Hell were after them. You have to have sympathy for this old blue-blood family. It's a movie so just go with it.And a bloody horror that delivers on the gore, written by Guy Busick and Ryan Murphy, it's not subtle but it's hilarious. Lovely Samara Weaving dryly works the comedy, and you can see the rusty nail horror a mile away, but it's a shotgun blast of a movie. (Sadly they're just for show). And wicked fun. Production design by Andrew M. Stearn was just creepy enough in a rich person's home is my gothic castle.And as dawn breaks I had to wonder about last man standing at this shotgun wedding, and the family succession, now that would be an interesting outcome. In laws are crazy, but some are seriously rich!There's your meek will inherit the 1%'s earth.As a follow up I want to see all the family games being played in Le Bail's Gambit.
What a senseless movie made out of an intriguing concept. Great actung by everyone except the supposed heroes/heroines. Just exhausting how the lady keeps saving herself.

Well what made me want to watch this movie was the red band trailer and once i saw it i was like wow i have to see this. It looked amazing and i just had to see it. Well now after seeing it it kinda was as expected and it did as it was supposed to and it was good. I really enjoyed the ending it had a weird twist but it was good and cool. I mean there is a lot of twists in this movie which are cool. There was also a lot of good kills and creative kills in the movie as well. The idea is quite nice and i really thought it was a good idea. This movie feels like how movies nowadays are supposed to be like and it has that modern feel to it. The acting was great and it was really good. The characters were all great and some of them were diverse and had their own ways. There is also some comedic parts which is funny. I gave this film a 9 because well i really liked it and there really wasn't nothing bad about it. There was some really great scenes and some really great shots. Overall an awesome movie and i really enjoyed it!!!! 😊

Review title: One of the Better Horror Movies of 2019
Review_body: Simply put, Samantha Weaving (The Babysitter, Mayhem) makes the movie. She is perfectly cast as the newlywed about to be part of a nightmare of a family. She brings her bad-ass vibe with a touch of humor that makes the movie great!The plot was fast-paced and engaging, the dialogue was campy and fun, they used the right amount of gore, and the supporting cast did a great job (looking at you Adam Brody and Andi McDowell).I was entertained from start to finish and this is one of the better horror movies of 2019. Don't miss out!

Uhm. Wait. What? You see. Hickory dickory dock.
What was that ending? Carrie's revenge?
Is this what happens at the Kardashian/Jenner mansion?
Do they sacrifice a virgin basketball player then drink his blood?The premise was just too bizarre.

Review title: Funny but could be much better.
Review_body: With some humor but far from dark comedies like Tucker & Dale or Mayhem. Considering the story the level of madness falls far short.

With an off-the-wall story, this thriller is certainly different. Its very well acted and has great production. Its well polished sets and music give the air of a top quality movie. Its good but it won't appeal to everyone so it will be in the cult genre.
A comedy horror which is derranged is the best way to describe this movie. Some nice gore and some comedy quips along with a rather good suspenseful story make this worth the 1hr 40mins.
Its a good film for some but some will not like the leftfieldness of it. Worth a watch altogether.

Well! Well! Well!
A family ritual goes wrong when the victim turns rogue.
I should say that director duo Matt Bettinelli-Olpin & Tyler Gillett's second full length feature film was an absolute entertaining horror thriller laced with good comedy that will make you laugh even in tense situations. Amazing camerawork, lighting and performances by the lead actors especially Samara Weaving makes this movie a memorable one. Even though the movies is kind of predictable but the execution and narration will keep us engaged. Tyler Bates Background score was an added advantage.
I should say Ready Or Not is a best example of horror movie with violence and horrifiying tensed scenes and not without jump scares.are you READY OR NOT???

Review title: Absurdities after absurdities saved by hilarious ending
Review_body: I called it absurd because while the writer or director could actually make it into a pure thrilling terror with fear, much blood, and evil motive behind all the sinister actions conducted in this hunger games style hide-and-seek, they decided to execute it in a more comedic style. Some people might like it, I don't. To think that the bad guys keep making stupidly laughable mistakes, despite their lives on the stake (and some of them don't even want to play it but hey, it's their lives or the others'), make this movie seems less evil, less gore and I can't quiet find such fun in such movies. It's okay if you want a happy ending where the victim survives, but at least, make it terrifying, make the effect on the victim lasts forever. Despite all of that, I kinda like the ending, it's pretty funny, even though it's pretty horrifying (kinda remind you of how Dr. Manhattan from 'Watchmen' (2009) kills people). Maybe that's the perfect way to end it: if you want to have a hack-and-slash movie with comedic style, be ready to have a same style of ending. And thank God, it doesn't get cut or censored!

Ready or Not is about a newly wed bride that has to play a game in order to officially be welcomed into the family. The game that is chosen is hide and seek, with the catch being if she is found... well you can tell from the trailers.The one thing this film really does well is keeping the tension high while also supplying well executed humor. Which is vitally crucial in a silly premise such as this one. The sister's husband plays a role that embodies the audience as he is questioning the games logic, pageantry, and real end game. His humor along with his wife really makes the movie memorable.Much like real hide and seek the entire thrill comes out of the high tension hiding moments and the sporadic running scenes. These are thrilling and they felt more intense because the writers wrote a character that seems a little deeper than other scream queens of the recent past. We are even given a character in Daniel that helps carry the story when she isn't in the picture.Once we get past all the thrill and kill moments comes the third act or more importantly the end. This had all the momentum going into it from the previous scenes, but the end just falls flat. Honestly they should have added another 20 minutes to this as I would assume audiences are wanting more to the lore, or maybe that is just me. Where it stands now its okay because it was out there and few probably would expect it but you will go away thinking it had a lot more potential.This movie should be watched but there is nothing spoiler heavy that waiting until a home release wouldn't be the most viable option. I can see myself watching this one again in the future.

Hear me out. Ready or Not is NOT a good movie.
Seem some people actually like it, but it still doesn't make it good. Unfortunately, no matter what you say somebody is going to disagree with you. Is it a comedy? I don't know, it was trying to be funny at times but I did not find it funny at all. Is it a horror film? It is gory at times (people getting their head popped off) but it is not scary at all. Seems even the directors (Matt Bettinelli-Olpin and Tyler Gillett) couldn't agree on that, or maybe the writers wanted to make a comedy and the directors wanted to make a horror film? either way the result is a nearly-unwatchable B-grade movie which disappoints on all possible levels.The characters in this movie are caricaturesque, but not in a good way, they just appear to be stupid. Their actions and reactions to event seems to make no sense. Even the lead actress Samara Weaving who looks promising at the beginning is becoming more and more annoying as the movie goes on (stop screaming for heaven's sake!) and the ending is just idiotic.
I would honesty be ashamed to recommend this movie to anyone, I can, however, recommend V/H/S (2012) by same directors if you are actually looking for a good horror movie. Bottom line: watch the trailer and save yourself 93 minutes of agonizing screen time.
Exact score: 38/100

This movie was so much fun to watch! The story was great, there was tons of gore and so many funny bits. I loved it from start to finish, especially the ending scene. This was just a great movie all around with plenty of surprises thrown in there! 10/10 would recommend to anyone, horror fan or not!!

Review title: I got pretty bored along the way but...
Review_body: I don't know if it was fun or boring, but the cleverness and wits of the direction made it work. The comedic touch and the use of nice music were good.

Little 'mishy-mashy' to start with but hang in there, this becomes an absolute romp and thoroughly entertaining, and frankly Samara Weaving is AWESOME!The story is great, yes, it does ultimately make total sense, but remember to watch this movie as a comedic horror otherwise you will get the wrong idea about it.Adam Brody and Mike O'Brien are pretty well suited to their roles and carry them of in Hollywood style, as do the entire cast.The sets are perfect, the old house the 'hidden features' and the decor, along with the great camera work, lighting and 'marginal' score add to a truly nightmarish comedy that will ultimately unravel a masterpiece story that has a; 'didn't see that coming' finale.Synopsis: I had no idea what to expect, I loved it. Don't watch this if you think it isn't supposed to be funny!

An interesting plot but it turned out to be a kind of mix of Adams family and Jumani with some murders. Don't expect horror. It watched away OK, I wasn't bored, but all in all I expected much more after reading the story

In a year where we have been force fed mindless retreads and paint-by-numbers blockbusters (cough... "Lion King"... cough... "Endgame") it's great to see a fun, low-budget flick that is original and entertaining.Samara Weaving kills it as a woman who's wedding night doesn't go anywhere like she expected, being force to play "Hide and Seek" for her life. The film is funny, scary, gory, and thrilling from the beginning to the mind-blowing ending. Highly recommended.

Review title: Almost didn't watch it because of the 1* and 3* reviewers here
Review_body: Listen, even if people saw some flaws in it, it definitely does not deserve a 1 or a 3 or even 5. It's a good one time watch, that's all I'll say.

Some say things go downhill after marriage but with Grace and Alex they get a particularly sinister turn. On the night of their marriage Grace is forced to pull a card from an ancient box - a heirloom of her new family. This is the game each new member of the family has to play to insure its future prosperity. Usually the game is harmless, but Grace pulls out "Hide and Seek", which means her in-laws are supposed to hunt her down and murder her before sunrise...READY OR NOT Is a tongue in cheek horror movie, as satirical as it is terrifying. Playing with the concept of murderous in-laws it shows to what extreme one has to go through to belong to a new family. Samara Weaver fills the shoes of a fragile heroine who quickly learns survival skills in a labyrinthine gothic mansion, when like many newly weds she realises there's no happily ever after.The film has a perfect pacing and a great cast, each of them with some memorable idiosyncrasies that make them very much alive. Adam Brody, a divided brother of the groom is a show stealer, and Andy MacDowell shines as the family matriarch and a reluctant killer. Her character's transformation in the film is the most interesting one.The soundtrack by Bryan Tyler is incredible and is the heart and soul of the film. It also makes a great stand alone listen.READY OR NOT has enough suspense murders and gore to satisfy a seasoned horror movie lover and its cleverness is what makes you talk after the credits finish rolling. The script may be very simple but this is also the case when simple means simply awesome.

I enjoyed watching it , kept me on the edge of my seat but..sadly the ending sucks big time. I WAS CURSING MYSELF DURING THE ENDING.. whyyy oh whyyy.. this movie had so much potential! I gave 7/10 coz of the amazing storyline BEFORE the ending

Review title: Jagged writing. Can't decide to be a comedy or horror.
Review_body: With better writing you can see where this would have tried to go. The problem is that even with a very nice cast the movie jerks between the two themes never really transitioning smoothly. At times it feels like the direction was "okay this time we are going to kill someone for laughs" or "in this one the murder is serious". It's one of those movies that you find that you never heard of and after watching it you understand why. Not the worst thing available but in six months I doubt I remember anything about it other than Samara Weaving was in it. Knives Out works much better if you want to watch a messed up rich family murder movie, though not nearly as bloody.

As crazy as they come. Not sure why I liked this so much - maybe the color, the music (classical), the thrill of the chase, the folkloric story rooted in the classic short (and black and white feature) "The Most Dangerous Game".
This is The Most Dangerous Game if Tarantino got his hands on it. So in some ways the initial develpment is a bit predictable, and not always fully credible, but those would be the only weaknesses. You'll have a good laugh if you're into black humor. You'll have a jump or two from the edge of the seat. Bends a few genres in a similar way to movies like Cabin in the Woods, Get Out, or maybe even Mother!, but is probably a bit funnier than all of those
Love Ready Or Not! It's Crazy, Gory & Funny! Awesome Performance From The Stunning Ms Samara Weaving! My Ratings : 10 Out Of 10 Stars!
Had parts of being different. But at the end it was so corny. And how cool she thought she was at the very end. Beyond corny. 4/10 boring lame movie.

Review title: Spoiler but read if you've seen it!
Review_body: What the Hell Is with The Horse Sounds She Makes when She Gets Off the Table at The End with The Knife in Her Hand?!?!?!?!? It's the most disturbing sound I've ever heard in my life. It actually takes away from her beauty!!! When you hear it. You won't be able to unhear this terrible ghastly horse seizure SOUND!! SMFH!!!!!🤢

Don't really understand the bad reviews. This was good fun. Considering how many poor and disappointing movies that keep being churned out in recent years, and lack of originality, this was a breath of fresh air. Especially with all of the remakes, recycled and predictable garbage of late. Samara Weaving completely stole the movie as the lead.90 minutes of fun, gore and laughs. We had a good time watching it, and the ending was perfect!Watch this as a non serious dark comedy horror, and you'll have a fun ride. Splatter gore, thrilling, hilarious deaths but with the added bit of tension of rooting for the leading lady.

What a meh movie. No character development, lame action & dialogue. Very similar motives with many B-grade independent/small budget studio thriller movies, studio just add some famous actors to played it. No new horror idea Hollywood?

Here's my review of 'Ready or not' . So 'ready or not stars Samara weaving who happens to be a Margot Robbie lookalike . The movie's about a girl who marries into a super rich family who have a tradition of playing a game , one of which involves playing hide and seek but the other members of the family have to kill her before Dawn . That's just about it. It's a neatly directed claustrophobic horror movie which has elements of black comedy in and out. That's something I loved about this movie. The tonal shift from funny to scary to weird is so fast in this movie and yet doesn't feel odd anywhere. The music was also gripping and helped with the setup for most jumpscares. I don't usually talk film school , but the lighting in this movie was gorgeous . The only gripes I had were with the use of shaky cam in certain scenes . Other than that , it was a pretty good b grade flick with gore , action and thrills. The ending however ... That was unexpected .

Movie flew by for me. Was exactly what I thought it would be and played out at a good pace. It's important to understand that there is comedic satire in this bloodfest. It's not meant to be taken too seriously.
Words can not describe the maniacal laughter in my heart when the rich people got what they deserved.

Look at the point map. Anything that is half a bottle of water sloshing, thrills are all based on jump scare, plasma is not open, and humanity is more serious, hard work, comedy stalks are not forged, cult is not mysterious.

When Grace marries Alex, love of her life, soon alex family hunt grace to perform their tradional ritual to keep their family alive. Now, the question remains does she manages to defeat this blood thirsty relatives or become victim of their game.A Black Comedy Horror film with the comedy fading at times due to the brutality of the killings.The family engage in Satan worship and sacrifice goats as well as those new family members who choose a fatal game. Even children participate in the hunt.What I didn't enjoy was it was a little predictable with some parts. This film is to watch,It is not too scary, and overall the gore is silly enough to not 'wince.' Enjoying movie

I loved this movie , it was unique and entirely brilliant in its own way . There is nothing like it and Samara Weavings performance is phenomenal and will probably go down in history as one of her best as well as this movie , it will surely become one of the most successful and well recognized horror movies!
I hope it goes up for a tone of rewards as well as the actors !
Samara weaving will definitely be a future oscar winner (fingers crossed)
Watch it for fun, some cool moments and comedy. Blood and kills.Likeable and despicable characters.No point to watch it and then complain - go into lighthearted or watch something else.
I absolutely loved this movie and if you're someone who enjoys a good thriller (think cabin in the woods) then you'll enjoy this and it will definitely be worth your time

Review title: Rush of Comedy and Thrilling Chase
Review_body:
This movie had a thrilling element from the beginning, the comedy was spot on and the leading lady did a great job with her character that made it more enjoyable. The movie could have gone full on horror and it could have also worked. Except for some parts I believe the movie did a really good job to be entertaining.
According to my rating strategy:Story: 1/2, Task Fulfillment: 1/1, Actors: 2/2, Direction, Cinematography and Soundtrack: 1/2, Viewer: 2/2, Wow Factor: 0/1

"Ready or Not" is billed as part comedy, part horror, however it takes itself way too seriously to actually work as a comedy (or isn't actually funny, or both), yet is far too slap-stick and clichéd to work as a serious horror film.Good horror films all have one common thing in common: they lend themselves a certain creditability so that on some level at least, you start to wonder if it's real. You start to feel creeped out and afraid a little. Those kinds of films make you check the back seat of the car before you get in on the way home from the theatre. "Ready or Not" has none of that.So we are just left with this meandering romp that maybe works for the first 1/3 of the film, where it carries a little promise, but completely lost me after that and I just didn't care what happened to anyone after that. In many ways, this movie is a good example of everything that is wrong with modern filmmaking. Films used to be made for grown ups, with grown up themes, and grown up ideas. This, on the other hand, is just silly slap-stick for 90 minutes (that feels a lot longer). What's next, "Football in the Groin?"

It's a really intense thriller full of thrilling scenes and a lot of twists, however suffers with its trailer that showed a lot of spoilers and important scenes. I also loved the cinematography, the character development, the acting, and the scenarios, the technical aspects are almost Oscar worthy.The weakest thing in my opinion was the rushed ending, I would give more 10 minutes instead to finish the movie in a bloody and fast way.Avoid the trailer (or try to forget it) because it shows a lot of important scenes and some funny jokes. Because Ready or Not is surely one of the most thrilling experiences of this year.

It was super cheesy and there were a lot of questions unanswered. My main issue was that her hand had a giant hole in it but she wasnt bleeding out, could still grab things with it, etc. If your hand is that destroyed it would be useless.But if you overlook all of that it was a good 'movie night' movie.

I understand suspension of disbelief but the basic premise of this movie is stupid. They needed to put more effort into explaining the back story if they expect me to go along with the plot. Otherwise this is a silly horror film for children. Cartoonish without substance.

Action, thrills and some laughs. The write of this story is a genius. It held our interest. It's so different from anything I've seen. I can't understand any bad reviews. You know that there is some dark humor from the write up. Not too much though cause I'm not into heavy dark humor. For me it was mostly exciting and scary, but the laughs were appreciated. It's a nice escape from the same old plots. We both really enjoyed it.
What a fun movie about marrying into a family w peculiar traditions....it's fun, original, great sets, great costumes, sit back, relax and enjoy the dark comedic moments!
This film doesnt really fit into a genre, comedy, horror, or thriller. It is a weird film. It is violent and the writing is kind of meh. The storyline is unbelievable and a little off the wall

Remember when movies were fun? Well the filmmakers of "Ready or Not" do and do their damnedest to bring a sense of lighthearted fun to a dire situation. The tone is fresh, suspenseful while providing jagged, but fun, interruptions to the horror. The actors bring their A-game. A fun watch!
It starts with a bang but the third act is underwhelming. Too bad. The lead actress is hot as hell.

Review title: Well I was looking forward to seeing this film.
Review_body: I was really waiting to see this film. I was very dissappinting. Ridiculous plot, terrible humor, cartoonish horror. This was hard to make it through.

There's a subset of action/superhero/horror films with young 120-pound white girls in heels kicking ass. I find most of the them eye rolling and skippable. However, this one works on every level, Samara Weaving does a great job in the lead role and the script doesn't turn her into a total Mary Sue. The story is straight forward and fast paced, the humor and gore strike a good balance and there is just enough tension and suspense to keep you into it until the final scene.

Review title: Lots of potential but brought down by some clichés and bad choices.
Review_body: So for one thing, I don't know why Alex (the husband) didn't tell Grace (his new wife) about this whole tradition. He says he loves her but apparently not enough to tell her about all of this. In the end though, he turns and tries to kill her after seeing her kill his mother, who was in turn trying to kill Grace - so I guess the husband just didn't think this through very well? And yes, obviously I realize the movie wouldn't have happened if the he had told her, but come on.That was one twist, which occurred after the husband broke out of his capture by sawing the wood of his bed frame using the chain of his handcuffs... I don't think that's physically possible but whatever. The second twist, which was a clichéd but also one of the movie's saving graces, is that the unenthusiastic brother (Daniel) of the husband finally accepts that his family are all terrible people and deserve to die. He poisons his family somehow, but we never actually see it unless I missed something, and this ultimately buys the protagonist some time so that she can survive until dawn at the last minute.Honestly though, everyone in this movie, even the hired help (who all end up dead anyway), are all absolutely terrible people, with the exception of the protagonist (Grace) and I guess the husband's brother. And not only that, they don't even have any redeeming qualities. You hate them all throughout the entire movie. And that's not a bad thing, it just made the happy ending more necessary and predictable - not to say that this movie's trying to throw many curve balls.I was disappointed by some of the poor character choices and also the fact that we don't get to see the bad guys suffer for their actions a little bit more (they literally just explode instantly without even feeling anything). Alex begs for forgiveness but we already know he'll explode too so it doesn't really matter. Also, early in the movie they introduce secret passageways in the house, and then use them once and never again.I suppose that kind of summarizes the movie really. Good ideas that perhaps weren't used to their full potential. However, the movie is entertaining and the protagonist is fun and likeable. I found myself routing for her the entire time. I would recommend this movie if you want a fun, albeit slightly sloppy entertainment ride.

Review title: Tradition dictates that when someone marries into the family
Review_body: Tradition dictates that when someone marries into the family, they must select a card on the night of the nuptials (after all, this bunch got rich selling board games) and play whatever it suggests. Poor old Grace picks a deadly game of hide and seek - and she's soon fighting for her life as her new in-laws, led by parents Henry Czerny and Andie MacDowell, hunt her through the house. While there are spoiler-heavy reasons for the carnage, the tenuous plotting from scribes Guy Busick and Ryan Murphy is really just an excuse to watch Grace try to survive the slaughter - alternatively, if you've ever wanted to see MacDowell in a full-blown punch-up, this is your chance. Coupled with some on-the-nose satire of the weird 'n' wealthy, the results resemble a blood-soaked Trading Places. Co-directors Tyler Gillett and Matt Bettinelli-Olpin (anthology movie V/H/S) keep it brisk and ballsy, while Australian breakout star Weaving (niece of Hugo) makes for a compelling lead as she emerges from her shell. The lurch towards an over-thetop CGI-heavy finale doesn't entirely satisfy, but Ready Or Not otherwise feels fresh, funny and absolutely crazy.

You know that when a film garners this much hate and reviews which call it "Sick, sick, sick" and "disgusting", and go on and on about how all the "violence is towards women, blah, blah" ... it has to be something special.And this one is.It is resonatingly (yes, I made that up) witty and really quite funny. In fact, it is almost too funny to be a "horror" film, and although it was certainly gory, it had nowhere near the gore of most horror films. It was just right IF you are looking for a film to satisfy the horror-seeking fan in you and which makes you laugh at the same time. In my book, the best of both worlds.As for the reviews which mention violence towards women: get over it. I'm a woman and I detest women like these reviewers who demand to be seen as something more, but then fail to live up to being able to 'take it'. Grow up. You give real women like me a bad name by association.In closing, this is one I highly suggest you watch for yourselves and make up your own mind about, but go in knowing that there is humor in it and hardly any scares. In short, a bloody good time.

This was one of the most entertaining films of the year ! You will never get bored , it's full of action and suspense and a lot of gore ! It has some comedic bits that make the film even more fun to watch and although the whole story with La Bail and La domas is kind of bizarre and stupid makes the film more special , more unique . The actors were great . One of the best horror films of 2019 be sure to watch it ! Also that ending was so so so so satisfying!!!!

I've seen copious amounts of much worse movies that still had interesting elements in them that might make them worth a watch.
Now Ready or Not, I wouldn't even watch again on a plane.It starts with the most dangerous game premise we've all seen before, which wouldn't have been such a deal breaker if we didn't start with the game already being played by the rich Eyes Wide Shut weirdos and if there was more creativity to, well, everything in the movie basically. Five minutes into the movie there is literally nothing left to discover. All the plot points are shakily entering the frame clutching a walking frame and you have to sit there and deal with it.I love horror comedies but as a general rule of thumb exemplars of both individual genres tend to be terrible for the most part, it's even rarer to see both combined successfully. As you can tell by my rating I don't think Ready or Not hit the jackpot.
The comedy isn't funny, the thriller elements aren't suspenseful or tense. In a desperate attempt to make this movie appear to have any edge there's lots of swearing, which might impress a kid with conservative parents who gets flogged for saying "hell" instead of "heck" but to me it was just tiring. There's an art to profanity big and small. Tarantino-material this is not.So, what else is there? Some quickly aborted attempts at class commentary, a couple of uninteresting kills for the easily impressed, a single splendid haircut, depressingly serviceable production value and a pet peeve of mine, something I call the Idiot Plot. A plot that can only happen because everyone in it acts likes a complete idiot.Ugh, I feel like I aged a year watching this.Most aggravating of all, this movie comes off like the makers thought they were making something smart and subversive. Not only are you trapped in a room with someone with bad gas, no, he also loves the smell of his own farts.
A very unique kind of horror movie. Had me entertained the whole time and very interesting ending.

Review title: Pretty Good for a Horror Movie
Review_body: The difference between this horror movie and about 99% of the others is the tongue in cheek humor and the great actors who somehow manage to make you laugh in the midst of full on gore. There is also a bit of a cautionary tale mixed into this one with the children involved in the mayhem that engulfs this movie. It does NOT glorify the gore, nor does it completely ignore the wrong-headedness of what is going on. But somehow, it manages to be, to me, way more entertaining than the Chuckie movies or the Saw movies which seem to be steeped in gore without conscience. It definitely makes fun of rich people, something I have absolutely no problem with since they do encompass our Congress and run the world in reality with little regard to the middle class, the poor, or the elderly, etc.And perhaps that is why there is a lot of downrating going on. I guess a lot of people want their gore without any tugs on their guilty consciences! The actors were all superb, especially the leading lady, Samara Weaving and Andie MacDowell. I was pleasingly surprised at the humor and horror mixed just right by Ms. MacDowell in this very different roll for her.The script was tight and excellent. The director did an great job getting just the right mix of humor and evil out of this group. It was an oddly engrossing film for the genre. I actually like horror movies, but rarely would rate one above 6 stars because they just aren't that good. This one is the exception. If you have a weak stomach for blood, definitely not for you. But if you enjoy a good horror film with great acting, directing, special effects, and a story that will not leave you wishing you had watched a Hallmark Christmas movie instead, this one is for you! One of the best horror films I have seen. If it gets the momentum from movie watchers, I see this one becoming a classic in the years to come! Definitely recommended.
A little more thought and kick up the humor a notch and this movie could have been a riot. Its not a scary movie by any stretch. It should have been a comedy.

Ready or Not is a Good movie to watch presentation of movie is so good and performance by lead actress was Like Cherry on The cake strong supported by Others Cast screenplay of movie is good and Story is Amazing and Keep u thrilled and Unaccepted climax makes it worth watch.
Absolutely entertaining, lot of blood and gore, the acting is good enough, the movie concept is really quite good. It supposed to be more comedy on every scene but it's alright.

Review title: Enjoyed every single minute of it!
Review_body:
If you watch every movie like a critic, this isn't for you. But if you watch movies for what they are meant to be, entertaining, this is one hell of a classic.
I enjoyed every single minute of the movie and especially the ending. It was a unique take on Satan cult movies and you just stick to the tv screen from start to finish.

Starts at a high tempo and draws you in from the beginning, doesn't really slow down and keeps you guessing all the way to the end. The beginning makes sense when you realise what's going on at the very end.I love the final scene especially the very last dialogueWorth watching especially if you love blood and gore, it isn't Saw level gore, but it's nice to see special effects as opposed to implied injuries.

There's a lot of blood in this movie. A lot of gurgling death quells. Wrong people dying. She should inherit everything in the end. Will she inherit their morals as well? Given that people will do anything for money. Considering they had to kill her before dawn they should have been much more crazed going after her. They underestimated her ability to escape their murderous intent.

Would you like to make a Get Out 2: Ready Or Not? Sure, we all do. Simply add the following ingredients, won't we?97 parts "Get Out"
1 part Shirley Jackson's "The Lottery"
somehow 1 part "Midsommer"
1 part Richard Connell's "The Most Dangerous Game"
garnish with a sprig of "Eyes Wide Shut"This delicious although admittedly 100% unoriginal cocktail could, possibly, make you howl with laughter at unintentionally funny dialogue or wooden acting or a somehow tonedeaf script or a horror comedy that has somehow managed to take itself too seriously (?) . If you drink more than one you will begin to boo hiss at every turn. Drinker beware!

It reminds me of Cluedo but there's no puzzle. Everyone's out to get the girl. It's well shot, holds your attention, and a little funny along the way. A bit of gore for seasoning. It's a unique premise and overall disconcerting in the end. A shock horror flick for the Instagram generation.

Pact with the devil and it whets the appetite.
Samara Weaving gives a good performance , and at times even better.
Some minor flaws are present but a nice change and a breath of fresh air than the regular glut that floods the market nowadays.
6 million spent, 57 million raked in , just says it all for the time.
I wouldn't mind to watch this again for one more time. Just for the kicks, and that black humor.
Time well spend.

There is nothing refreshing about this one although a valiant effort was made. A combination of a slasher/supernatural element is unique (Friday The 13) but this one didn't know which end to concentrate on the most. I appreciate endings like the one in this movie but, I felt little to no suspense throughout this entire ride. The humor and slapstick nature is a feature that strips the movie of any possible intensity. This is a solid streaming movie do not worry about saving your money, It will be streaming on an app or two shortly.

What a little gem. I'd never heard of it but hubby picked it for movie night. Well. I'm so pleased he did. It had everything. It was gorey. Very tongue in cheek. Fantastic characters and pretty top notch acting. I'd only heard of andie McDowell who was superb. She plays crazy mother in law so well. But the other actors were top of their game. I had to cover my eyes so many times and I'm not squeamish. The main character was so bad ass. Loved her!!! Brilliant ending.
I would sell my soul to watch this for the first time. I absolutely loved it. The gore was so good and the plot twist at the end.

This expensive movie might have been fun if it had centred on the delicious omniscience of kids and their betrayal of the vapid adult idea of their innocence, with the children teaming up to terminate the adults. We grin inanely, pat little boys on the head and spout idiocies to these stunted beings, but they can see through us and soon return the deception by playing along. Among the few satisfying moments of this dross is when she slugs the kid who shoots her in the hand: nobody wants to admit it but the potential of children to be evil is high, something they learn from adults very early on. The hyperventilating Samara Weaving was one of many low points of this tawdry excursion with a budget of 8 million that grossed 57.6 worldwide. The mind boggles.

Despite some predictable moments and dumb decitions I enjoyed it. Creepy and fun premise, setting, good cast and characters and great acting. It was twisted, gory and went in new directions several times. It kept me guessing and I would recommend it. Something different! Sadly you can't expect horror flicks to be good anymore, but this surprised me!

Review title: Are you Ready to rumble on your wedding night???!!!
Review_body: Ready or Not is a fresh take on the slasher genre. It crafts a creative arch on the basic storyline concept that is rarely done in movies with similar genre. It is not the typical house invasion or vacation goes wrong.Ready or Not serves a plate of dark comedy that escalates as the run time goes along. What makes this so great is the general get to spot each laugh easily, not just its specific target audience.For a slasher film, Ready or Not deserves an applaud for its remarkable acting performances by the cast. Everyone shows their distinct characters from behaviour to costume that they are so entertaining to watch similar to that feeling when you get dozens of characters to choose from in a game.The lead character, the one who you will be rooting for is created in such a way that she is not dumb like in most movies. However, she is not smart either but the circumstances make her character safe from the trap of being a daft person. In other words, the movie does not unravel her intelligence nor her ludicrous manner.Also, the lead character has little to no character development. The fundamental question of her historical context and background is extremely lacking that we as the audience fail to connect with her as humanely as possible.The biggest complaint has got to be the rushing third act (final 30 minutes). The first two acts peel its layer off one by one steadily but the third act however loses its balance and goes downhill. They tried to do something completely different but it fails to satisfy the audience because we want something more pleasurable than what they have given us.Verdict: Ready or Not is a phenomenal gem that breaks the stigma free of 'slasher genre is dead'. However, it is not considered a masterpiece although seems very close due to its disastrous third act nature that falls short compared to the other two acts.

Not a dull moment, it really works well the comedy horror, great casting all round. The family come off as normal rather than deranged which was a change. I laughed so much when non of them could properly fire their weapons.
It reminded me of Get Out. Main lead did a great job. Ending could have been better.

To be fair I was ready but then I was not.
I found this movie boring and very long winded, I say this because the hunting and killing started really early in the film and just continued to be the same throughout.
Not much story line as the game started to early for me.
Nice simple movie with a few silly parts but worth a watch when it's discounted.

Samara acted her butt off. Reminds me of Margot. Good comedy relief throughout. Had to rewind parts because it was worth it. It's like a violent version of Clue (old school classic). Better than expected.

Watch this if you like horror comedies. I gave it just 6 stars only because I am not a fan of horror comedy genre. But still, this movie was better than expected. The comedies were not forced. At the same time, the characters were somewhat nicely developed. I felt like caring for them.Ending was not so good as I expected. Maybe I was hoping for more.Anyways, this was a somewhat of a good time pass for me.

Review title: IF YOU'RE CURRENTLY READING THIS AND TRYING TO DECIDE IF YOU'RE READY OR NOT TO WATCH THIS FILM... WELL GET READY AND WATCH IT!!!
Review_body: Well... lesson learned... Never play games with the in-laws!!! Ready or Not is original, gory, witty and one hell of a bloody fun ride!!! The actors Andie McDowell, Samara Weaving, Adam Brody and the rest of the cast were absolutely amazing!!! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS MOVIE!!! I AM TRULY BAFFLED BY THE LOW RATINGS AND URGE EVERYONE TO IGNORE ANTHING BELOW A 7.

People who rated this film 7-8 or higher are just delusional average movie-goers. It's an average horror comedy flick. Similar to the Cabin in the Woods. Not too horrifying and not too funny imo. If you're not too smart this type of comedy is probably very humorous to you.This movie gets a solid 6 which is highly generous because many movies out there are a lot better than this junk with lower ratings on rotten tomatoes.

Review title: You won't feel cheated by stupid jumpscare or panic open lock/car start cliche.
Review_body:
Most horror/thriller always have stupid cliches just for raising tension without anything to do with story line, that kind of under aged kid tried to scare someone: BOO!
This movie won't cheat you that way, their acts and what's happened are pretty natural and logical albeit a bit comical as intended; this is a comedy afterall.
The actings are pretty good, I can say excellent. Storyline also well, enabling character development a bit with many turnarounds, and ending was acceptable/good, though not spectacular.
I will sure expected to watch more movies from the director and writer. If anything they missed, since profanities seemed to be very casual today, their habit seem also slipped through the movies they made. Much less for people in high status (like they are in this movie), any decent families will never openly says foul words like nothing.

Review title: Fox has found a heap of rubbish (expectedly)
Review_body:
Watched this movie just because already have watched everything better which is more or less easy to find, and what I can say after watching is that my impressions of trailer and plot description were fair and this picture definitely suffers from ability of providing anything valuable, interesting and beautiful.
What we observe is just another ridiculous speculation on the same theme, and even with similarly crooked title, as was "You're Next". There is also an unreasonable mixture of comedy, horror and something just silly, so the movie doesn't make at least a drop of sense and after watching is forgotten in the nearest week or like so. Moreover, there is no outstanding performance no exciting memorable music no unique visual composition or director's viewpoint. The ending just makes you cry and feel sorry about spent time on this rubbish.
However, as some efforts were put into production of this film, in the whole there is a cohesive structure and there definitely were some unpredictable turns as well as enough amount of violence which was not overobviated during the script, it deserves not the lowest rank.

Review title: Best horror comedy of the year (so far)
Review_body: Ready or not stars Samara Weaving (whom you may recognize as the titular girl from The Babysitter) as Grace, a young woman whom has just married the son of a wealthy family. Said family seems nice at first, but there is actually more to them than meets the eye. As soon as the wedding ends, both Grace and the family have a seemingly casual get-together. They recommend playing a game with her, and the game just so happens to be 'hide and seek.' But little does she know, the game is a much darker and deadlier tradition in the family household.What I liked most about this film is the portrayal of the main heroine. Instead of being a blank slate, she is very charismatic at the start of the film. And when all hell breaks loose (literally and figuratively), she is able to dig deeper into it while fighting for her life.Another thing I liked was that not all members of the family were homicidal maniacs. Besides the wedded husband (who later betrays Grace at the third act), his brother Daniel is the one who later comes to Grace's defense. At first, he comes off as a know-it-all d-bag. But as the film progresses, he turns out to be the most sensible one out of the family.Now that I've praised the film, are there any gripes that I have with it? The short answer is 'kinda.' As soon as we are introduced to the main heroine, she is shown to already be wearing the wedding dress and just so happens to already be inside of the house. Not that it was a bad introduction in any way, shape, or form, but I can't help but wonder how she and the family (and even her wedded husband) met in the first place; I might be nitpicking, but that was a portion that I felt was missing.Last but not least, the theatrical release poster, as it clearly shows the main heroine wearing what appears to be a large bullet holster. This would lead the audience to believe that she'll use a gun at some point to defend herself, when, in reality, she carries a rifle once, but never manages to shoot (anyone) with it; she does kill one or two people in the film, but not with a gun.Overall, the performances were terrific, especially from the lead actress (Andie MacDowell looked phenomenal, especially for her age), and the ending was both disturbing and hilarious at the same time. this is my second favorite movie of the year so far, and I'm giving it a solid A.

Review title: a flawed attempt in satirizing wealth and tradition
Review_body: Occasionally interesting, griping and visually dark in concert with the thematic subject, Ready or Not is a flawed attempt in satirizing wealth and tradition in a family setting.Grace Le Domas, played by Samara Weaving, is newly wed with Alex (Mark O'Brien), a member of a wealthy family who secretly practices satanic rituals. When a person is married to a Le Domas, the family initiates its new member by undergoing a game of card drawing. Whatever game comes out of the box, the new member and family does. Grace unfortunately draws hide-and-seek, which ultimately results in death for the new member. Ready or Not follows Grace as she aims to survive until dawn.The film's strength lies on the unapologetically dark, shadowy and moody visuals. Most of the scenes are shot with minimal lighting, presenting a setting of horror steeped in old money. However, the narrative has serious issues because while Grace is a strong character, her development as the film progresses shows little depth. The supporting characters are stronger because the events peel off layers that motivate them to be part of the Le Domas. Daniel, played by Adam Brody, the brother of Alex experiences the most progression because of his successful betrayal of family tradition. Ready or Not therefore suffers as a whole because the themes should enhance the main character. Instead, we see Grace most of the time running without providing an additional layer to her character.Ready or Not is a unique approach in the dark comedy genre without becoming derivative.6/10

While it may be a bit gory in places, I certainly laughed more than I jumped, samara weaving is good in the main role and the supporting cast do a good job
I wouldn't call it a horror film though, it never really makes you jump at all, but in my opinion it is more of a really dark comedy but I enjoyed it nonetheless, there is a lot of blood and some really funny bits, all in all it was a pleasant way to spend an hour and half

A few jumpy bits, a lot of laughs, a bit of blood and gore, and a great performance from the cast, especially samara weaving, all in all a good fun film, I would say it is a comic horror film rather than a straight out horror though

Review_body:
I went in to see it with an open mind thinking it was going to be something similar to "you're next" which i loved... Hmm however it wasn't lol
I do like Samara Weaving looks like the doppelganger of Margot Robbie.... I did think she was kind of cool and liked her character... But i was just d disgusted with the rest of the cast...(family) with the exception of Daniel Ledumas (Adam Brody) i like him..... But i just found it unsatisfying in the end... I did like the idea of the storyline.. Seemed interesting... I just wish. they would have executed in a different way. Mehhh 6 stars i like the main actress.. And Adam Brody... That's about it.. I wouldn't see it again. Again it's my opinion lol

The end made the movie go to 9 stars!!

What types does this film classify? Uh !!!!!! It is advertised as Horror, Mystery, no we have to review the definitions of his words.
This film is a comedy!

I mean, right from the trailer I could have guessed how the storyline would be. A woman (Samara) getting married into her husband family, who has crazy rituals - hide and seek and kill the one's hiding.But the suspense and horror and plots are well made. Overall enjoyable horror movie! The ending is quite the twist did not expect that all. It's crazy!

Review title: My stomach is in a knot
Review_body: I have a pretty high tolerance for slasher movies. I know if there is a closeup on a victim, the bad guy is probably a foot away. Or if a door or drape is opened suddenly, there will be a loud musical note to make you jump.This movie got me a few times.I agree with others, that the end wasn't great. They seemed unable to find the exit.Nonetheless, I forgive them for that. It was a surprisingly good scary movie.

The film i understand was made on a low budget and all was filmed in the one big house and parts of the gardens and road outside, that's cool as you don't see many films like that anymore, really smart idea they had and it payed off on this particular film, personally i didn't know any of the cast, which was not a bad thing, nice to see fresh actors sometimes but the cast they chose suited it well.I read some other reviews saying that its based off this and that film, the plot is stolen off this film, its a copy of this..... i don't even know what this film was copying and i don't care because i enjoyed it.The film its self was not bad, its a weird but good combination of thriller, horror but combined with comedy which actually makes for interesting parts of the film, one part someone gets shot in the head with a crossbow, but its by accident in the film so its funny, me and others laughed in the cinema even though someone just had there head shot with a crossbow. there are many scenes like this throughout the film, yet gory, the comedy makes it that little bit better.Most of the film is the whole cast stumbling around the house trying to look for Grace, while killing each other off unintentionally by their mis haps, Grace ends up fighting every off and hiding enough to actually survive, but the ending was funny and really the only part CGI was needed a lot, they don't end up killing Grace and the curse gets the better of the cast and they all explode.Overall its good for a low budget film, the funny bits weren't forced and had the right amount combined with the horror / thriller.Age: 25 - Cinema: Cineworld Stevenage 2D Normal Screen (Unlimited Card) - Watch, Consider, Avoid: Watch for a laugh with some popcorn.

A+ for creativity. Great cast. My only problem would be the ending. I could think of a few different ways they could had ended the movie on a better note. I ended up leaving the theaters a little bummed out about it lol

This is an 18 (UK), though I don't know why. Seeing 18 - strong gore and violence - upped my expectations somewhat, and I felt a bit flat to see only a few holes, and spurts of blood here and there. There are a few body explosions, but nothing different to exploding things in "Stranger Things" recently, which isn't an 18. Anyway, I would suggest you simply watch the trailer, and leave the rest to your imagination. It's okay, maybe 6/10, but your imagination might give you a better experience.The family in this film just wasn't odd ball enough. There's one slightly off the wall aunt, and a coke addled sister, but otherwise nothing to give the movie what should have ideally been a household full of all sorts of crazy people which, depending on a range of differing odd characteristics, may have served the comedy aspects a little more, and some areas of horror too. Has a supernatural aspect that for me could have been left out, though I suppose it justifies the change to otherwise seemingly normal behaviour, bar a few exceptions. Also a bit odd that the person being hunted, for a game of hide and seek (this is all in the trailer btw), NEEDS to be alive for an organised portion of the proceedings later on, however the family go hunting for her with weapons that would likely lead to them accidentally killing her, rendering a reportedly necessary event to occur later in the movie unlikely, cocking the whole thing up. All the blood in here for the most part stems from botch ups in trying to secure the person hiding, so seems like their approach was a little short sighted.I would suppose if they were so invested in a particular outcome, they may as well have just played a regular hide and seek game, had a drink to celebrate the end of the game, the person hiding (now found) being rewarded a sedative laced drink to make doing the whole end bit easier for them. This is after all a comedy horror though, so I don't suppose it helps to apply any logic to the proceedings.

The third act of this film is what saves it. The first 2 was weirdly paced with some awful dialogue and some non funny "jokes" however I will admit I liked this film. I liked it in a weird good 1 time watch kind of deal. I would be bored out of my mind watching it again considering the twists in this movie are what makes the third act save the film. I give this an above average summer kind of horror kind of thriller mix movie. A 6/10 is fair in my opinion. Had the first two acts been as well done as the final act we'd be talking about a damn near masterpiece.
This is not the best thriller movie i ever watch, but it was fun. The only lack thing is the story that really simple as i am someone who enjoyed somethings complex.
