I dont k ow why the negative reviews this movie was so good and bloody I loved it

Dis is one of the best movie dat i enjoyed watching ... And I love dat Kind of movie where I don't know wat going to happen next .. and dis movie is dat kind of movie !! Wel Acted , Brilliant story , Screenplay is at best . Must watch for everyone..

Feat. The most unlikely "accidental" deaths, the fastest boiling kettle, and Adam Brody.This isn't bad overall if you know going in it's an average at best movie. Based on reviews I had much higher expectations and that kind of ruined it.It's got some funny lines and pretty good cinematography. The storyline is of course outrageous but it's a fun idea for the genre. Very thankful that upon discovering what "the game" really entails Grace just accepts it instead of going through the typical 30 minutes of shocked disbelief. The things I didn't like were how Grace all of a sudden decided screaming at the top of her lungs was a good idea while the entire family is trying to hunt her down and kill her? Otherwise she's a pretty smart character and Samara Weaving does a great job. I thoroughly enjoyed Adam Brody in this genre, but that's just as a die hard OC fan so take that with a grain of salt.Overall, wouldn't watch again but a good flick to watch over a glass or two of wine with friends.
I was so sure that it was gonna be amazing...oh boy was I wrong. Such a good plot, but the humor was previsible, not funny at all, the acting was kinda bad. So yeah, don't bother...

Review title: It's like that movie with that cabin in the woods
Review_body: It's more of a comedy thriller than a horror. I dont know why its rated as low as it is. Not a blockbuster, sure, but it's pretty entertaining. Would recommend.
In a way if took in that sense it's a fun movie to watch
A movie that doesn't bore you. Allows you to laugh a bit and keep you in your seats entertained. Not really a "horror" movie but rather a fun, gory and ridiculous ride that you don't want to miss!

Great horror, gory comedy! Samara is perfect! This film really puts her through the ringer from damsel to take no prisoners heroine! Great casting and writing! A definite must see film. Grab the popcorn, turn the lights down and enjoy the ride!

Review title: Would give Infinity Stars. My Favourite Movie of All Time now.
Review_body:
I'm a big horror fan and my preferences are a little different from others. I like movies with sick and sinister games, movies with a variety of characters to choose from, movies that dont lose 'horror' while adding 'comedy', movies with a cheerworthy protagonist, or movies that are good till the end. Any of these traits make me like a movie. Thats the reason I hate movies like Hereditary.
Ready or Not, however, was an unexpected bomblast. At the time of its release, I felt like its a boring old fashioned horror (I'm a modern horror fan), so I didn't even research about it. An year later, when I was in quarantine, I found Ready or Not's sypnosis quite attracting. Finally, I decided to watch it and it is my favourite movie now. I would give it infinity stars if possible.
Ready or Not offers a range of characters from the funny, dumb Emilie to the Caring yet deadly Becky. Needless to say, Samara Weaving stole the show by a far margin. Her performance was uncomparable. Probably one of the best movie performances ever. After that, the rest of the crew was no less either. The problem I get with most movies that offer a varying personalities is that as characters die, the movie gets boring. But Ready or Not gives us a roller coaster ride with a satisfying ending, which makes me smile everytime I watch it.
The Hide and Seek Song is a very effective song as well.
Moreover, Ready or Not has a perfect dose of comedy and its protagonist is not stupid. Samara Weaving has always killed the roles she played no matter if it was The Babysitter's Bee or Bill or Ted Face the Music's Theodora.
The movie is worthy of a watch.
I recommend it 100%. I hope we get a sequel.
I am scared that I am gonna watch movie like this one again. What Ever this movie is trying to show or tell. Fails! Waisted time.

Samaras scream is the most annoying and irritating thing I have heard in years she screams way to much and just uggg if you see this movie just be prepared to hear the most annoying thing you've just ever heard

Not a horror movie, more of a comedy with dead people. None of the "events" are truly surprising. The movie is too predictable throughout most of it's run. The trailer gives you pretty much the whole movie in a nutshell. The main characters start out likable, but by the end you just want it all to be over with. Clichés abound, about the only thing good is the evil aunt. At times, she's hysterical. It's worth it for free tickets, or a second-run cheapy theaters. But to pay regular theater ticket prices for this??? Wait for it to come out on Netflix or Hulu...

This film was top notch when adding comical characters and suprise kills. Def not going to be everyone's cup of tea. But for those who love survival films with a strong protagonist, this film is great. Biggest event of the film was finding out if the family is truly cursed or not which I wont spoil.

Very original, very funny, very entertaining, go to see it is very good movie, many think it will be a serious and scary movie but do not go with that idea, this movie is funny and is suspenseful and I feel that it is something very Original and great to bring these categories together and people who didn't like the movie is because they are dumb.

I don't know why there are so many awful reviews about this movie on here, but to each their own. I thought it was an entertaining film and the dark humor mixed with gore was satisfying. Graces character was well written and tough instead of whiny and actually lived through it all which was a surprise since so many films of late seem to be the 'everyone dies, watch the world burn' kind of plot. Yes, some parts were silly and the way it ended was unexpected to me but I like dark, obnoxious humor and I guess some people just dont. I honestly don't think any movie put out these days is worth what you have to pay at the theatre to see it, but I didn't leave this one complaining about how I was ten dollars poorer and wasted another two hours of my life so that's a start. Overall, I thought it was a good movie. In this age of incredibly short attention spans, I think some people just didn't actually watch enough of it to warrant giving it a review. If you knew you wouldn't like it after just watching the trailer, why would you pay to go see it at all?

This movie was fantastic from the beginning to the end. The storyline was excellently written and masterfully portrayed. It moved quickly and had me on the edge of my seat the entire time. This film had aspects of horror, suspense, violence, gore, some comic relief, and plot twists all rolled evenly together. It was more believable than most (or all) other horror movies and in good taste. 10/10 would recommend watching, and is in my top 5 for best horror/thriller movies.
The ending could have been so much better. Not just a few explosions...

I really enjoyed this movie. It's cinematographic beautiful made, filled with humor and a nice amount of action/gore (although there could have been a bit more gore). Grace kicks ass playing this game of hide and seek. You really want her to win and even the 'bad' family members aren't compelety psychopaths like Leatherface and his family 😅 It does make you hate the rich though, if you didn't already.

A rather interesting idea for a movie was ruined in how the movie came together. Swear-words are thrown out every second (often two or three words per sentence) as very crude poor attempts at jokes. Very unnecessary and bring the movie down as a whole. In a dark comedy hide-and-seek movie where to win is to survive through the night you're obviously supposed to root for the protagonist Grace. But the actoress and the writing for Ready Or Not make it so that the protagonist is very unlikeable. Makes the movie hard to watch overall. If it wasnt for the unlikeable protagonist/actress and the (very unnecessary) consisstant swearing throughout the movie. Ready or Not (2019) would be a 5/10 movie.
Very entertaining with its dark humor. Will keep you guessing and you'll never know whats coming next. ending isn't lacking either. Loved it!

Coming into this, it was already sort of giving me the You're Next vibe. Ironically, You're Next was centered around a strong female lead also trying to escape her new families psychotic side.Ready or Not definitely delivered in the same sense, with the perfect balance between funny, and gruesome. Combining these two genres isn't easy, and they pulled it off well, without making it cheesy in any sense of the word.

Didn't have any hopes for this movie after hearing the premise but seeing the trailers made me optimistic as a horror comedy about playing hide and seek seemed intriguing. With tons of gore and blood this movie deserves its R rating. Multiple funny scenes with more humor than scares is what this movie is best at. Seeing these adults try to use old machinery to kill someone is hilarious. I will say you can draw some many similarities from this to Jordan Peele's Get Out which is kind of cool to compare. Overall fun movie with plenty of horror I give props to the director as this was a great idea that was executed perfectly.

Review title: Sorry but what are those 1 and 2 stars about? Didn't you get the movie?
Review_body: Yes, this is not a horror movie as any other. It is much better on the lines of "The Cabin in the woods" and "Pride and Prejudice and Zombies". If you take it seriously, you can not like this movie. If not you will laugh a lot and like it pretty much.It was acted pretty nicely, it had great characters in there and there are a couple of pretty good inner conflicts and psychological turn arounds which were pretty good. And with the comedy aspects this was one of the better moviews I've seen in the recent years.If you are here for the horror thrills, search for another movie - if you like comedy, cool shots, a nice storyline and pretty cool characters you are dead right and should have a look at the movie. It might not be perfect but 7 or 8 out of 10 is a valid rating... 1 or 2 out of 10 is just not.
Honestly this was a great film. Really funny & entertaining. See it for your self and please dont compare this with any other damn film.
Starts off a bit slow, yet quickly makes up for that a quarter into the movie. That's when the guts gets spilled and the glory is claimed. Literally...

The movie plot is fun but the overuse of the F bomb in the dialogue takes away from the classiness of the scenery. It would be a good family movie for me and the kids at Halloween if it wasn't for that.
This was a typical no-brain movie. Storyline was so weak and there was no real "horror" or scary parts. Actors were bad and comedy felt forced.Just a really bad movie and not worth watching.

Review title: Exhilirating Survival Horror with some Toungue-and-Cheek Supernatural Elements
Review_body: Awesome movie, aesthetically and in terms of pacing. the main actress did excellent! She didn't come off as some 'already-badass' person that wasn't scared of being chased by killers...she came off as a genuinely terrified person that has to muster their full courage and sheer will-to-live to even get out of her dire situation. In that sense it felt more relatable. I also liked the whole premise that this ultra-rich family believes all of its wealth is due to some mysterious, magical figure that made a covenant with the family's patriarch, and that the family's wealth depends on following the enigmatic rules set out by this mysterious figure: each new family-member by marriage must choose one card from a magical deck of cards and play the game described on the card...only some of the games have deadly consequences. The icing on the cake for me and which really surprised me is that the ending was really satisfying because the 'magic is real' but still enigmatic and unknowable...... A beautiful mix of survival horror and Faustian wager (sell your soul for great power).

Review title: A very great movie for this genre
Review_body: At first I was not sure to watch this movie considering some bad reviews and the rating.. After watching it I found out that this movie is greater than the most of other movies with higher ratings i have seen in this genre..its speed, plays, script and ending..everything is amazing..full of suspenses, fun and excitement...I really enjoyed it.
So this is just a rip off of Shirley Jackson's "The Lottery", and not even a good one.

Review title: Samara Weaving, will you marry me?
Review_body: I found it rather interesting that, in this movie, a satanic family is killed by a girl named Grace. On more than one occasion people say "Jesus Christ" when addressing her... so it's like the satanic family was killed by the Grace of Jesus Christ. I laughed hysterically when everyone started exploding due to a failure to meet the conditions of a contract with the devil... I couldn't tell if that message was pro satan or anti satan. But it is by FOX. Which through that numbers chart thing is 666. Spooky.

Well done simple bloody story.
At least they don't pretend there is more than a pretty face trying survive from nutcase.
And that's all is needed. And good acting for everyone.Like the ending.

I mean, was it a very good horror? Not really.. But you know why? Because its a horror comedy movie thats why, thats how they are ffs, silly and all. If you rated this with a 1,then probably you cant read the genre of a movie before you see it or you are the kind of viewer who thinks only movie from 1980- are good. If you expect to see a Oscar movie, then my god, why do you even watch this? Just because a movie its silly, IT doesnt mean you have to give it a 1/10 because you cant laugh. From my point of view, its not a bad movie at all, the acting wasnt the best, but again, what comedy had a good acting with characater development? (no, nobody care about your 1980- masterpiece guys). If you want to have some fun with your friends i would say its a good movie to watch.

Not worth your time. I spent the full 1 hour and 35 minutes cringing. The story was so predictable and I did not find the attempted jabs at "dark humour" very funny. Not one likeable character, especially the lead actress who spent most of her time yelling like a banshee. Don't watch this unless you really enjoy the feeling of wanting to blow your head off.
There's a whole Hail Satan at the end. Don't watch this. Terrible movie overall.

Review title: it is the best horror movie i have seen
Review_body: Don't go by the low 6.8 rating. It is so much better than that. Samara Weaving has woven the story so beautifully, it blows your mind completely. Even after watching the movie so many times, there will always be guaranteed chills by how powerful the acting is. Samara Weaving killed it!!!!
Samara Weaving acting is phenomenal. She is the perfect one to play this unique character.
Samara weaving do her job effeciently as usual . this movie has dark comedy with some scary clips. l love and very enjoyed that movie

This movie is so different, so fresh, so new! It is unique and fun, also a bit spooky. Movies these days all look alike, stories are similar and plots are predictable, but this one is one of a kind! I love it and I recommend it to everyone all the time!

Fast moving, fun, light-horror experience. Weaving in the lead carries the movie with her great performance, but the rest of the cast all do an awesome job as well. I'm a big fan of movies that take place over a one night/in a single location and this one definitely takes advantage of the situation in very inventive and violent ways. A must see for any fan of the genre.
Some aspects were silly but the ending was satisfying. Great light hearted horror comedy.

I don't go to the movies nor am I a big fan of this genre, but what a pleasant surprise. I went because of Melanie Scrofano and the entire cast was funny and well suited to their roles. It is just good horror comedy fun. Samara Weaving's performance was brilliant and unfortunately will likely be overlooked given the genre. Highly recommend this movie.

Maybe this one isn't smart, deep, or revolutionary, but it has a sense of bloody and stylish fun that carries throughout the whole movie. Great protagonist and some really fun villains. Good twists and turns, with a satisfying conclusion. Just a good time.
A unique movie. Rating this 10 so that the overall rating goes to 7 or up. Because it deserve to be there.
Cheap version of Get Out. If you watch this first it is okay. If you watch watch out first and then watch this, this is so cringe.
This is pretty much a rip-off of Channel Zero season 3. Which did it much better in my opinion. So skip this and get hold of that instead. Gets a 4 for production values.

Review title: Dark Violence, Dark Humor in a nearly perfect blend
Review_body: In "Ready or Not", Samara Weaving plays a woman marrying into a very rich family. But that family has a very strange ritual when a new member joins the family. They have to pick a card and play a game. And one card in particular means a serious turn for the worst. And you know what card comes up, right?So this is one of my favorite genres - a thriller with lots of gory violence and plenty of humor, both just funny but mostly very very dark. Plenty of fun one liners and plenty of gory endings. Weaving does an amazing job of showing how this otherwise normal person rises to the occasion, despite being put through one of the most grueling wringers I think anyone has ever had to do, at least since Chris in *Get Out*! She has a great transformation and her expressive face conveys everything. I imagine it was probably a pretty grueling filming even.And the rest of the cast, led by Andie McDowell and Henry Czerny, were great and it was full of all kinds of actors that you go "Now where I have seen that actor before?" And a special shoutout to Brian Tyler for the amazing soundtrack. There were light touches when needed and some serious percussion when that was needed. Bravo all the way around!
Really enjoyed the movie, with a good mixture of horror and fun. Samara Weaving is great in the leading role.

In brief, this is a well thought out plot with great performances and some good jumps thrown in. A credit to the horror/comedy genre. Throughout the movie the characters acted as anyone would in their different circumstances, often leading to the comedic aspects of the film, they were never generic killers or victims with convenient expertise of random things. I will say it keeps you guessing up until the end if the actions of the antagonists are rationalized or not, and I left the theater very satisfied with the direction they director chose. Highly recommend!
This was one of the worst movies I've ever seen. Dumb story. Dumb writing. Don't waste your time. It wasn't entertaining at all.
I wasn't expecting much and perhaps that's why I enjoyed it. I know it had it's weak parts but T'was a fun film.
I couldn't stand this movie it's completely so unfair and just unrealistic as hell with zero tone and horrible characters. Awful.

One of the stupidest films I've seen in a long time.
Dumb,boring and completely unrealistic
Don't bother
A classic game of hide and seek; but with much more blood. Grab the popcorn and enjoy a dark comedy, or perhaps funny thriller, that is a damn good time.

Review title: All credits goes to Samara Weaving !
Review_body:
It breaks my heart to see such notes as 1 or 2 stars for this movie. But come on, it is not a masterpiece either, but it brings some interesting stuff to the table.
Color grading is a bit off to me but at least they tried something.
Samara Weaving is amazing, I mean AMAZING ! I was watching her during many scenes and told myself "damn she's good in this role". Can't wait to see her again.
Oh, and I loved the end ! I wasn't expecting this and I enjoyed it a lot.This being said, I have an unlimited cinema card so I can go to see whatever I want. Probably wouldn't pay 10 euros for this kind of movies anymore, but hey, that's why unlimited cards exist (at least here in France !)

Pulse pounding excitement, rib splitting comedy,spine tingling suspense, and a damn good time. An absolute blast of a film with fun and interesting characters, fantastic performances, and a crazy plot that keeps you on the edge of your seat.

Review title: Worst movie I have seen in a long time
Review_body: Bad acting, not so funny moments, bad script... I did not like it at all!! In fact this is the first time I walk out of the theatre before the end... This movie is really pathetic, don't waste your money!

Review title: Still figuring out how to get my time and money back.
Review_body: Andie McDowell was on The Today Show praising the "very smart" dialogue and the brilliant directing. Wow, great salesmanship Andie, I'm going to buy a movie ticket and go watch it! 10 minutes into the film the warning signs begin that this movie is a huge mess - acting, pacing and writing and execution of ideas. Even the great Ms. McDowell doesn't seem quite comfortable in how to play her character at times. When the screenplay writers ran out of scripting ideas, the F bomb was inserted, over and over again. It's one of the worst films I've ever seen and it makes me want to venture out even less to the movie theater and take risks with my time and money.
I was hesitant to watch this but glad I did.. This movie has suspense, thrills, twists, horror and even comedy... this is one you won't be sorry you watched

I have no idea how this movie acquired a rating over 7 stars let alone, a rating, over 2 --the only way i could see that as a possibility is if every cast member and employee on set, were forced to come on this site and give it a positive rating ... it's ABSOLUTELY, horrible

When I saw the German title for this movie "Ready or Not ... Auf Die Plätze, Fertig, Tot"
I was like what movie is this. Let's watch it....I have never laughed so hard in my life.
I love comedy horror.
A pretty fun ride regardless of the illogical plot. It was thrilling and entertaining

Review title: Pretty good for what it is
Review_body: Pretty good for 90 minutes of entertainment. Kind of a dark comedy. The script was somewhat color-by-numbers, but had its moments.
For a movie of this genre, the acting was brilliant. Nobody let the film down.

Movies are supposed to be entertaining, right? Ready or Not was, from beginning to end! I loved this movie. A horror/comedy with a bit of a plot, amazing. If you know what you're getting into, then you won't be disappointed. It just premiered on HBO, go watch it.

Well written, supremely acted, airtight, and tons of fun. The bloodshed is largely intentionally over-the-top and at times even goofy in the best way. The chase is really exciting without being too "nerve-wracking," the deaths are often hilarious, and a dumb little rich kid gets punched. Never a dull moment.Also, there seems to be some borderline inspirational, maybe even Christian symbolism behind it all? This is never at all distracting, but fun to pick apart and think about long after the movie ends.I can't recommend it enough!

It's obviously not a masterpiece, but it's not trying to be one. I wouldn't call it a horror movie, because it's not really scary, but the movie is full of action, fun and sometimes even funny. A good choice for an easy night out.

Review title: A fun if slightly silly comedy/horror flick. The 1&2 star reviews are clearly paid
Review_body: I'm not a big horror fan but I really enjoyed this movie. It definitely does not take itself too seriously and it has a lot of fun along the way. Not particularly original but a good watch.Anyone giving it a 1-3 star either has an agenda or it's the first film they've ever watched. There is way way worse than this!

Review title: Great fun gem of a movie
Review_body: People rating this movie a 1 or 2 are simply just wrong. Your reasons for a low rating like that is just ridiculous. It's a comedy horror and clearly states that and the trailer clearly shows you that. Sooooo why moan about it having comedic moments in the movie? Just plain dumb.This is a comedy horror done right, it's dark humour breaks up the gore and violence up perfectly. The characters are perfect from the creepy over the top aunt to the leading protagonist Samara weaving. Acting is on point and the movie never slows up(dig to the crazy person saying it's boring)The movie actually has an ending, and what a great ending too. The movie delivers on everything they intended to give you and more.Sooo don't listen to the non constructive low critics and make your own decision and go watch

Review title: It's ok but derivative and predicable
Review_body: The story isn't all that deep and pretty much predicable. But it's well acted and at times funny. No real horror or Scarry moments. So I'd say watch it when you you don't have anything else to watch.

Hey guys,what's with the high praise and score of this attempt at dark comedy????
Am I the only one with a brain who doesn't find anything entertaining,successfully funny or unpredictable? It's really sad what classifies as horror nowadays,the state of cinema overall is just pathetic.
Laughed more than anything wor lass liked it though

-ly predictable as expected. Just by watching the trailer you're basically already watching the whole movie. There's almost zero character development, no suspense built up, and even less plot twists. Nothing really goes on without you already expecting it. It has the basic horror movie 101 jumpscare with no actual scary things happening. Even the humours are tasteless and overly used by other horror/comedy movies. Overall, it's a good concept, but not enough great ideas went into the making of this movie.

This is a kind of movie I like to recommend to everyone. Each character is important and played very well to complete the whole story. I did not see any character which is unnecessarily added to annoy the audience as you can see in some other movies. Story line is easy and perfectly delivered until the end. I like to see more movies like this, it is filled with fun, sometimes sarcastic to our real life which is agreeable. You might also like Mayhem, and Tucker and Dale Vs Evil.
Didn't really know what to expect, but this movie was really good. Definitely a must see. We had to look past the foul language though.

I really don't understand all of the negative reviews here. The movie is very well paced and suspenseful it made me on the edge at all times. My night well spent by watching this. Love the dark jokes also

Review title: Best movie I've seen in a while!!!
Review_body: Totally unique idea instead of the same old remade crap! Really good!!
This film was AMAZING! Super hilarious and thrilling. Melanie Scrofano was just as phenomenal as always. This was perfect casting and a perfect story!! Highly recommmended,
I found it boring, usual things that happen in a movie.

I don't even know where to start. I loved this movie! The idea felt fresh, the actors were amazing. Although it had its slow moments there was always something around the corner.
Although hilarious and horror is something you usually wouldn't think to put together it just worked, reminded me of the original nightmare on elm street.The lead actress was great (especially at the end which was one I did not see coming and boy was it great). I do have to say in my opinion the star of the movie was Adam Brody, he played his character perfectly and just as you'd expect delivered some of the best/most sarcastic lines.
I have recommended everyone I know to go see this movie. Glad I saw it in theatres and will definitely be buying it so I can watch it at home!

Ready or not? I was not. This movie was so chaotic that there were some moments when I was asking myself "What the hell is going on?!" and I sincerely don't know if that is a good thing or not. But, I am sure of one thing and that the protagonist, Samara Weaving, really deserved this role. I really want to see a sequel of "Ready or not" because the ending put me in the fog with that blood twist and I sincerely can say that I wasn't expecting it. It is true that the film is not a masterpiece but if you are alone in a weekend night, this is the perfect movie for you.
Music and special effects were very good. I had to continually fast forward searching for a scene that made any sense......never found one. I should have taken a nap instead!

Loved this movie , very original. If you are a gore and comedy freak. Then you will love this movie. Great comedy , violent and gory
It's up there with my all time favorite comedy, violent and gory movie (Shaun of the dead) . This movie leaves on your edge of your seat and make laugh and make you go ooo gross. Great twist at the end.

The idea behind "Ready or Not" is simple as genius. While I've been pretty curious about how they would explain the tradition itself and why a future husband would act like that, I liked the actual how very well. The protagonist Grace goes threw a huge development, which to all time of the movie stays reliable to the audience. Most of the other figures are shown concrete and comprehensible. Especially when it's about what they think of the family tradition. The search of the bride threw out the night has many up and downs for both sides. The hunt is really thrilling with its little shocking moments. Simultaneously it doesn't uses unliked jump scares. While watching the movie, it kinda allows the audience to choose on their own wether they're on the bride's side or not. But after all the bride collects a lot of sympathy with her rebellious and authentic way. So I rooted for her until the end, which was awesome.
Great movie .The plot is great from start to finish, the actors act superbly, what a pleasant surprise.
This movie is not just some horror flick its pretty entertaining it reminds me of the old school cult classics, it wasnt boring at all. It had some laughable moments and pretty nice ending!

Fun movie that is not very lengthly. Graphic deaths countered by comedic themes. I would not recommend this movie to my mother or family but it has it's place with scary movie fans. Not an intricate horror motion picture but the video work is done well it is just lacking in storyline.

Review title: It is waste of the time
Review_body: It is the worst movie that I have ever seen. It does not have a meaningful story!!! All the movie is full of blood and violence. You will defiantly hate it.

Review title: Not the Best but Not the Worst
Review_body:
The idea was definitely there when this movie was made. It was very interesting and all tied together in an odd way.
The biggest reason I didn't line this movie was that there was things that didn't make sense in the way that characters acted and certian things that happened in the movie that just weren't realistic. This isn't a spoiler but an example of something similar that happened in the movie that wasn't realistic. It's like if a character stops someone and then runs away as fast as they possibly can. Then they stop for a minute to catch their breath and all of a sudden the character they were trying to get away from is right behind them.
There was just small things like that which didn't make sense and wasn't realistic to what would have actually happened in that situation.
That's my biggest complaint with the movie but it wasn't horrible. I will praise it for having no sexual scenes (except one small thing, look at the Parent's Guide) and had good plot twists that kept me interested in the movie.
Another thing I would like to add is that they graphics weren't great either. They weren't bad by any means but could have been better.
So, if you're looking for a truly good horror movie that makes sense and has a good amount of scare to keep you on the edge of your seat but plays out realistically to keep you interested and to keep the spooky factor. I wouldn't recommend this movie. But if you're just looking for some scare and something fun to watch, this isn't a bad movie.
I do not recommend watching it!!! Very silly and sick movie that doesn't worth a penny, I'm a big fan of horror movies but that's not categorized as such ..

Review title: Tarantino levels of gore and violence
Review_body: This movie is absolutely crazy from start to finish and is probably the most fun I've had in a cinema since Overlord. This movie is like a Tarantino horror film on coke. Go watch it.

This movie was great, the whole cast mixed well and I don't think there was a single dull moment in the movie where I felt it dragged or had any sorts of filler. It's gory in all the right regions of the film and the ending is bloody fun! Perfect balance of humor and violence in this cat and mouse game. Most of these critics need to stick to boring ole Del Toro movies.

Very interesting movie, great performance from all the actors, bloody and a little bit comedy horror movie.
Over all it's great movie and its worth the watch
I went in expecting a basic movie and it ended up being great. Loved the mix of horror and dark comedy!
Guys the trailer made it look like a real good thriller-Well it was more like a comedy film! Wow! Not what it say on the tin! And 18?? Really?

Review title: Goofy Horror Film, Just like I Like Em
Review_body: So, let me start by saying that this is not nearly as bad as some of these reviews will lead you to believe. Is it great? No. Is it good? Not really. Is it entertaining? I thought so. While falling victim to a lot of troops in horror, it does manage to cleverly subvert a few. Some decent actors peppered throughout and Samara Weaving giving a pretty good performance. Most of the other actors are delightfully absurd and over the top, playing their characters ineptitude and idiocy to pretty funny levels. A lot of the comedy Falls flat but there are a couple of really Hidden Gem jokes in the movie that made me laugh out loud more than once. The ending is especially twisted and satisfying. I recommend this movie. It's a fun watch.

It's a thriller and a suspense with a comedic twist to it which I LOVE. Super funny ending and i recommend watching this movie. It also reminds me of the movie called The Babysitter, so if you like that one, you'll love this one.
The movie had a great premise but was let down by atrocious writing and terrible acting. Some cheap jumps and a tonne of tropes.

Overall, pretty lackluster. Feels like the directors did everything for shock affect. Did lead to some very funny and illogical moments. Ending felt very out of left field. Very eh, don't waste your money/time.
Don't even bother with this movie. One of the worst I've seen...
Amazing movie to watch with accompany!!! also if u like tarantino movies u will like this movie also...

Review title: Everything makes perfect sense by the end
Review_body: By the time you sink into the premise of the movie, a lot of things might feel overboard and utterly stupid. But mind you, it makes perpect sense as you reach towards the end. A beautifully crafted, fast paced, well acted and directed movie which keeps you entertained till last "fade out" .
I guess I've never seen characters trying so hard.

Honestly don't listen to the bad reviews.
This movie is fun. People in here writing 6 paragraphs about how there was "less character development" or "bad execution" acting like Pulitzer winners.
I just read a review about this which said it has elegant gardens. What? You kidding me right?
This movie is a perfect popcorn flick.
Just don't think and just watch it.

Hollywood, maybe you're listening? This is exactly the kind of film I want to see. This film was the most fun I've had at the theater all year. It's equal parts thrilling, violent, funny, and well acted. I've seen so many lazy films this year, it's nice to see one that's so fun and well made.

I have to say that this was the best Horror/Comedy film of 2019. A lot of films have tried this mix of genre, but have failed miserably at it. But, this film was perfect for this mix. The film is not too much comedy nor horror. It's the perfect mix of the two. I love how the films grabs your attention by this. When there's a horror there's a sudden burst of comedy that grabs the audience's attention away for a bit. Then, a horror parts grabs the attention back. So, it's like a game of horror and comedy in this films. I just love it. I recommend this film for everyone.

I have watched some pretty terrible movies in my time and this one takes the cake. It's a pretty good concept for a movie just poorly executed with unnecessary "comic relief". The chubby dude I forget his name was extremely unfunny and was trying to be relatable but failed terribly. The aunt with the ace looked like she was out of a comic book and the drug addict sister was just unrealistic the gore was over the top stupid. In reading some of the other reviews, I think the producers made some marketing errors. The very first trailer I saw for this movie was very comedic in nature, but the later trailers seemed to be more horror. I would say the film itself was much more Dark Comedy than True Horror, or even Slasher. So those that go in with that mentality are going to be disappointed.In fact, the movie is a lot of fun and doesn't take things so seriously. There are plenty of twists and TONS of gore (if you like that sort of thing). Sure, some things could be better, but my wife and I loved this show!

Review title: Why all the haters for such a fun film?
Review_body: After a very weak summer of unimaginative big budget releases (Hobbs & Shaw, etc.), Ready Or Not is very solid and entertaining time at the movies.After seeing Ready Or Not, I just browsed the reviews here at IMDB, both professional and user reviews. I am surprised at all the scathing reviews for a film that clearly doesn't warrant it.What gives with all the haters?For what it is - a $6 million dollar, low budget horror/comedy - it is a refreshingly different summer time diversion. The high level of gore may not be everyone's cup of tea, but the comedy negates that factor.I also appreciated Ready Or Not's lean 96 minute running time. Too many big budget movies are bloated 2 hour and 40 minutes faux spectacles (listen up, Marvel!). If you can't tell a good story in 90 minutes it's time for a rewrite.If you are considering going to Ready Or Not, go and enjoy this fun movie - and ignore the haters!
One of the worst movies I've seen lately! What a disappointment! Bad script, bad scenes, everything is bad!

Review title: Not as good as the rating gives.
Review_body: I saw this movie and wondered if I should give it a try, I read some reviews and saw the rating and thought I have not seen a good horror movie in a while. This is my first review but I have been using IMDB for years. Well I was wrong, The film had no real substance, it started out ok enough but once it got into the main plot it became predicatable and pretty silly. I get the whole premise of the rich being able to do what they want but the deaths and the way they came about just seemed very far fetched and ridiculous. The plot although had promise showed no real action of reality of what was really going on. It reminded me more of poor 80s style horror that was cheesy. Watch it if you feel you want something to watch but don't expect anything other than waiting for the ending to hurry up some you can tunr it off.

Review title: Who wants to play a game?
Review_body:
Okay so, I expected to like this movie, but upon watching it, Ready or Not instantly shot into my top ten. I was drawn to it initially because it reminded me of The Most Dangerous Game. I absolutely adore everything about this film. The original song. The twists and turns that you don't see coming. And for the love of everything holy, someone needs to pay Samara Weaving to record every scream used in a horror movie from here on out. It sounds corny and somewhat entitled, but movies these days are so unoriginal and predictable that it's hardly worth going to a theater. Ready or Not was an absolute breath of fresh air with some real Shaun of the Dead vibes. Throughout the entire thing, I couldn't tell who was on which side, or who might show sympathy. It genuinely kept me guessing until the last nod.I can't really understand the low ratings. The trailers portrayed this film perfectly. Don't watch a movie that you're not drawn to, then leave a horrible review because you wasted your own time. Complaining about perfectly timed cursing in a rated R movie? Y'all are wild.ANYWAY...
Do yourself a favor and see Ready or Not if you are into horror comedy. Samara Weaving was incredible. The whole cast portrays every character so well. The jokes land. The gore hits. The twists keep going. I really don't think I could have asked for anything more to improve this film. It provides everything to make you fall in love.10/10 funny as hell
10/10 original execution
10/10 visually stunning
10/10 perfect cast
10/10 musical score
10/10 costume design
10/10 badass heroineThis movie has everything.
This is the perfect mix of scary, funny, and WTF. I absolutely loved it - especially Adam Brody's character.

I love the smooth of the story. But I expected more. With Alex happily ever after 🤣 but end up with divorce because Alex make a huge mistake in the end.When I watch the Thriller and I thought Grace fight, hunting them and kill one by one back because what they do. She's did the kill part but in the end of story. I love the story but not the ending. ( Especially upset with Alex ending part thts all)🤣
Except the smoking part front of the house. With the fire. I can feel the spirit.

I just finished watching the movie. (Spoilers) And I must say it was a decent horror movie. It's pretty formulaic in some ways but has moments that are genuinely scary/intense. With a premise that is unique, it keeps you on the edge of your seat for most of the run-time. Your always hoping the family won't kill her. The main character (Grace) does a good job of emoting and you start to like her and want her to survive. There was one scene in particular that had me very engaged and physically reacting. It's when she's climbing out of a hole and gets her hand stuck on a nail, you can actually feel her pain. The whole cast gives decent performances for the most part. Grace also seems to have a stiffy for cursing a lot which I found endearing.Now to get into what I didn't like about this movie. Firstly, I don't think it would be a classic horror movie; if there weren't some parts that just were kinda unbelievable. So, I'm not judging too harshly for some of these. For starters, the main character seems to just be oblivious to guns. When a girl shot and missed Grace by accidentally shooting another girl and the girl then drops the gun. Instead of running past and grabbing the gun, Grace just runs past her. You could say she was just too afraid to grab it that time. And then another time a boy drops a gun after shooting Grace in the hand and she doesn't even bother to pick it up. Lastly, after she strangles the butler guy in the field, Grace had another clear opportunity to pick up his gun and get in the car. But yet again she just gets in the car.I also didn't like how there is the moment when she initially met with her husband, and he was explaining to her everything that would soon to be happening that night. She starts screaming like a dummy.Then later on in the movie Grace finally makes it out of the house by crossing a fence. And as soon as the first car doesn't stop for her she immediately goes on this almost minute long, loud, curse fest rant about how that guy is an jerk for not stopping. When any normal sane person who wants to survive would have just shut up and kept running to try and put as much distance between themselves and the family.Another part that irritated me was the ceremony. Like the entire night everyone was shooting around blindly not concerned whether they killed her or not. Then once the husbands brother actually knocks Grace out and the father comes, the father doesn't immediately shoot her ensuring she would no longer escape. Instead, now there is this whole ceremony thing that they have to do, I guess that requires her to be alive. Dumb.Then there was a part early on in the movie where the father says something like "She's killing all our people" which didn't make any sense. Because the 2/3 people that were dead at that time were caused by the other girl who accidentally killed them. At that point Grace had only killed 1 person. Not taking huge points off here, but it kinda irked me.And the ending. I guess the writers did kind of a good job of subverting my expectations. I really believed that the husband was faking being part of the family again just to break his wife out. But the real ending feels almost un-earned. For him to immediately switch to his families side like that. Like his brother and mom just died and I get that should make him sad and maybe rethink some things. But to go from trying to save her the majority of the movie, to trying to murder her in the last act is kinda dumb. And you could say it was because of the one line of dialogue his mother had with him that prompted his change. But that would be also be dumb so don't say that.Another bad thing about this movie that irked me for a lot of it's run time, Is that they cuffed the husband around a cot dang bed post. Any man with average strength would have been able to break that thing with ease. But nope they just had him slowly chisel his way out with the handcuffs.I also almost wish they had made the movie a little longer just so they could add a little more interaction within the family. I feel like we didn't get to care about some of the deaths because we didn't spend much time getting to know them. I seriously don't remember anyone's names.Overall a solid C/C+ grade of a movie. Wouldn't watch again sober.. and maybe not even if I was blazed.

Did nobody research the rules to hide and seek?Hide-and-seek, old and popular children's game in which one player closes his or her eyes for a brief period (often counting to 100) while the other players hide. The seeker then opens his eyes and tries to find the hiders; the first one found is the next seeker, and the last is the winner of the round.One person counts, everyone else hides.Yes this is a dumb complaint because weapons are also not part of the rules.

This concept of being hunted has always been intriguing to me for a film and this movie had so much potential. It started out fine. There was an interesting build up to the point where the main character, Grace, finds out the reality of the game. But from there she's literally just running around from one place to another and eventually it got a bit dull. Also this might just be me, but the gore made me uneasy and was just a gross. Gore is not horror and should have its own genre in my opinion.Many points were also predictable. Like it was obvious Daniel was going to be the good one and help her. And it was also expected that anyone she felt would be safe, like the maid or Georgie, would actually be against her. When I heard this was going to be a comedy horror, I was expecting to see some goofiness but the majority of the film was quite serious other than a few moments such as Emilie and Fitch being the comedic relief. With the rest of the movie mostly thrilling, I was expecting quite a substantial climax.Alex turning against her was a predictable twist as well, but the movie from that point on made the entire movie pointless. Like the family members just exploded. What type of ending is that?! If they were all supposed to die then it should have been in the same tone as the rest of the movie. And also, with the ending it means that the family really didn't have any choice anyway.There should have been some way for them to evade it. If they had just ended it with none of them dying and realizing it truly was just a myth, it would have made so much more sense. Or if Alex had ended up reverting back to protecting her instead at the final moment, then maybe that could have been his redemption and allowed him to stay alive by fighting against the tradition. Instead they all exploded, meaning they should have killed her to stay alive because they had no other option.I turned off the movie with a wtf did I just watch. If it had been as comedic as the final moment for the entire movie then it would have been fine. But the ending just didn't fit with the rest of the movie which completely ruined the entire thing for me.Only gave it three stars because the setting was quite appealing. And the main actress did a good job in her role but just didn't have a good script to work with.
Highly recommend this movie as it is different than other movies and really engaging and interesting

Review title: A Fun and Simple Horror Movie
Review_body: I really enjoyed this. It doesn't try to add a bunch of plot twists that can lose you. It's just a straightforward comedy horror that's similar to Monster Party and You're Next.

When both Horror and Comedy are included in the genre of a movie, you know what to expect: A gory comedy that doesn't take itself too seriously and that you can sit back and enjoy. "Ready or Not" follows that recipe, building on an original premise that sets a fitting atmosphere for the story to unfold.When it comes to the characters, they are mostly one-dimensional eccentric caricatures, but this actually works out well for the movie, which is based on the variety and not the profoundness of them. The acting is pretty good.I think the movie is also supposed to be a satire about rich people and their families, which certainly adds to the comedic element, but do not expect any profound social critique. This probably was not even the point.All in all, it's an enjoyable movie that sufficiently delivers according to its genre. It is not a masterpiece, but it's fun.

I think this is more of a comedy with some horror elements. It has some tense moments, but it's more funny than anything else.
Seriously, some scenes had me howling. Loved all the gore and violence too.
I picks up fast, doesn't overstay it's welcome, no overly long expositions of anything, just straight up to the good stuff. It knows what it is. It's such a fun movie to watch.
It has some not-so-obvious twists that keeps you guessing, too. I mean this is no Citizen Kane plot-wise but it's well written. It has a message about wealth but it's not forced or on the nose. I absolutely loved the ending.I don't understand some of the low ratings but to each it's own. I read some people complaining this isn't much of a horror or slasher movie and... yeah, it isn't. So what? This movie is it's own thing. Dark comedy with horror, violence and gore. Anyway, it's worth a watch.

I haven't had so much fun watching a movie in a while. The premise is intriguing, the leading actress is impeccable, the soundtrack is fitting and eerie. It's not by any means a groundbreaking film, but it's entertaining in the best way, is both spooky and funny, and keeps your eyes glued to the screen and your heart rate up for the entire duration.

Synopsis: A bride finds out on her wedding night that she is to play a deadly game of cat and mouse as an induction into her new family.This movie plays out like a modern day The Most Dangerous Game pitting an unwitting newlywed against the dark nature of her newly acquired in-laws. Grace, our protagonist, is drawn into a frightening game of hide-and-seek when she draws a sinister card only seen one other time in the last 3 decades. The cards themselves are a gift from the long dead patriarch of the La Domas family who has made a deal with the devil long ago in a bid to keep his family's wealth for generations to come.The premise is that each newly inducted member of the family must play a game on the night of their wedding, a tradition that stems from the fact that the family fortune was built on board games and the like. Most are innocuous: checkers, chess. But if you draw the hide and seek card it gets dark quick, pitting the recipient against the entirety of the family.This dark comedy plays out inside the grounds of the La Domas family home, full of secret passages, spacious interiors and deadly (if not completely inept) in-laws.The tone bounces around a lot making any real build up of tension impossible. The characters are a bit over-the-top, particularly the aunt who is almost comicbookish. The protagonist is really a bit unlikable so it's hard to get behind her as she scurries from room to room, with the dawning realization of her situation.There is not much backstory to ground the characters and next to nothing is told of the new bride making it difficult to empathize with her. The stand out in this film is definitely Adam Brody as the brother of the groom who delivers all of his lines with dripping sarcasm and detached nuance.The comedy is a solid 'meh' but that's not to say the movie has no redeeming qualities. For one, the title song which is played as the hunt begins is creepy asf. Horror fans, like myself, will enjoy the many creative kill scenes, as each family member wields some remarkable weapons from the family game room. A comically large axe. A crossbow whose operator, at one point, must watch a youtube video for instructional advice. A derringer with a hair trigger in the hands of hair brained coke head.There is a also message about the insular nature of the 1% and the lengths they will go to preserve their fortunes which is the catalyst for these inane behaviors.Worth a watch.

I went into this with no expectations and rented it on demand Friday night. I also ended up watching it again on Saturday! Loved it!It's not a traditional horror file, basically just murderous and a lot of dark comedy (which is right up my alley).Everyone in the movie was perfectly cast but the lead actress of course steals the show. Adam Brody was hilarious and Andie McDowell was deliciously evil!I also loved the premise which was pretty original.If you haven't seen it you definitely need to see it. I bet you'll end up watching it more than once!

Review title: Awesome! (Haven't said that in a while)

Glad to know Satanists are still getting a good reputation *eyeroll*. The cringe factor was off the charts.
The story is old as ever and the ending works with children cartoons not adults movies, thank you for wasting my time.

Review title: I'm not sure what people were expecting...
Review_body: I had to create an account just to write this review as I can't believe the amount of hate all these top reviews are giving the film. Potential spoilers ahead on the personality of the main protagonist.The film is a good fun take on the slasher genre, with a few different things about it to make it stand out from the rest. One particular thing I have to say is Samara Weaving as Grace has to be one of the most believable performances for a character in her situation. She is constantly in fear and unsure of what is going on and at no point does she accept the situation is normal. From the countless slasher and home invasion style films I've watched, this is something that is often missed. She isn't suddenly smart enough to get herself out of every situation, she is believably a grounded person in that circumstance.The film has a fair amount of gore in it and seems self-aware about how ridiculous the situation is so there are plenty of dark comedy moments which I appreciated. Yes, some of the characters are weak and some decisions/choices that are made in the final act aren't greatly explained or justified but overall I had a great time watching this film, doesn't overstay its welcome and moves at a brisk pace. 8/10

I have to say, when I first saw the trailer i loved the gothic style of dress and how literally dark the lighting is throughout the film.The movie is pretty great. Review title: One star because zero is not an option...
Review_body: I'm all for B-movies but this was just the bad without any of the fun. The usual movie tropes that we've seen done much better a million times before show a complete lack of imagination. Completely unconvincing acting from the entire cast, topping it off with an annoying lead actress. Story full of plot holes like a Swiss cheese, devoid of even the most basic logic, coherence and believability. Bottom line, not a single saving grace for the entire 90 minutes of this movie, not a single good acting performance or good scene that I could highlight in the movie's defense. The high IMDB score is nothing short of a crime.

Review title: It's Not For Everyone But It's Great For What It Is
Review_body: So I won't give any spoilers, that's just not my style. Also I rarely even review movies in general. But after watching the film, I was like what the hell. I should write a mini review. So this shouldn't be to long.First and for most for what the movie is, it's really good maybe even great! It has a bunch of dark humor some cheesy some really good. But almost meshes completely perfect with the film. Clearly it has the thrill of a thriller, and a part where I myself even had a minor jump. The movie, started strong and ended strong as well. The twist and turns, the laughs, all of it was great. The main actors and actresses were really good. Thought Finch was alright and the lady who played Adam Brodie's wife. But all in all it's a movie that will grab you from the beginning all the way to end. It's a movie that I personally believe is going to age well. Also a movie I would watch frequently.

Review title: samara weaving is getting out of toxic family relationships for 94 minutes
Review_body:
This film balances on the verge of great and ridiculuos.firstly, about great.
the plot is definitely entracing, it manages to keep the intrigue throught the whole film. you simply cannot get bored, it's very dinamic. one thing is revealed after another, and the ending is not disappointing as well.although the idea behind the plot may seem a bit far-fetched, it is executed brilliantly thanks to great acting (shout out to everyone and especially samara weaving) and the way the film is shot.there is a theme of following your family values and who is truly your family, which is great, but also not very overbearing, the film doesn't delve into philosophy too much.and finally, about ridiculous.
as it's a comedy horror, it is expected to have some fun moments, and there are many of them, actually. humor in the film is intertwined with the absurdity of what's going on. but some special effects were a bit questionable in the end, which made me laugh when i shouldn't have.maybe if it was advertised as a fantasy comedy horror, which what it essentially is, i would watch it much earlier.

Review title: A-list performance with a B-list cast!
Review_body: Hi! For what it's worth. I love movies, work at a movie company (streaming), and hardly ever write movie reviews... With that said, here I am today to share my take on this production in the form of bullets.Samara Weaving gave an Incredible on-screen perf. Yeah yeah yeah she's like a Margot Robbie doppelganger. But holy cow I don't think M.R. has anything on Samara in this role.Mark O'Brien: Hats off my guy! Within the first 15min Mark and Samara established very clearly that their characters were in a deep, true, and invested relationship. That's a duo i'd like to see again sometime!Additional Cast: Just an absolute fit. Wow. Each character had their own set of unique traits that ultimately contributed to the plot and/or tone of the scenes. Shouts out to ALL OF YOU wonderful job!Plot: Sure you can draw similiarities to other titles, yes. But this one was drafted in such a way that you're almost forced to admit the fact that "yep, indeed, I have not seen something like this in a long while, possibly ever." Way to go writing staff!Overall, this was a film i'll definitely revisit. Not only for the fresh ideas, but the production, casting, acting, literally everything was a double thumbs up for me.I was hesitant on a 10/10, but the pure comedy throughout cannot be mistaken!Welp, gotta jet! bye!
Not funny, not scary. Predictable. Waste of time. Too bad I can not give 0 stars.

Review title: Loved This Movie So Much I Bought It Hours After Watching
Review_body: This is one of the best horror films I've seen in a long, long time. Not only is the acting top-notch, most notably by the lead actress who was amazing in The Babysitter, but the dialogue is so refreshingly good. Grace's meltdown when the passerby wouldn't give her a ride had me in stitches. That's probably one of the most real, hilarious scenes I've ever seen in a horror film. The plot was also solid and I loved the death scenes. Fantastic movie!

(In fairness, I knew from the trailer that I probably would find this movie too dark. If you liked the trailer, maybe you will like this movie. The Rotten Tomatoes rating convinced me to see it, but sometimes statistics can be deceiving.)Samara Weaving plays a new bride marrying into an unusual family, who have board games on display in their hallways and taxidermied animals eating other taxidermied animals in their living room. However, she soon realizes that things are even darker than they seem, and she has to fight to survive her wedding night.Unfortunately, that's about as much as the plot is developed. The movie could have been a satire on family dynamics or class, or maybe it could have pushed the absurdist elements to the forefront (instead of leaving that for the ending, which was just weird enough that it almost worked), but instead the flimsy plot is treated as an excuse to run through shock-value violence in which every meaningless death (most of them women) is treated as a punchline. Someone in my row walked out shortly before the end; I should have walked out long before.Although the great cast gives it their all, they are given little to do other than scream and run. A deeply upsetting and shallow movie.

This was by far one of the funnest, funniest, and craziest horror films I have seen in years! What horror film dreams are made of! And the storyline is original and a very interesting premise. Well done. This will be a campy classic!

Review title: One of the stupidest movies ever
Review_body: Ridiculously stupid and boring movie. Facepalm. What happened with this world and art.

As my title suggests this is another dark comedic dive into slasher films - which I am excited about. Not overly original but seemingly a perfect mix of serious thriller/horror and accidental fightback comedy. It almost feels as though 2017s The Babysitter and 2009s The Last House on the Left were meshed together to create a steadily building suspense, all while keeping things somewhat light and real. A dark comedy in its truest form.Our protagonist does not come out unscathed mentally or physically by any means, as we see a Carrie-esc bride covered in blood and... human remains emerge from the once bright and carefree woman she was in the beginning. Undergoing changes at the same rate that her once beautiful wedding dress does.I very much enjoyed the acting which I felt was both deeply satisfying and unsettling as all actors appear to fit perfectly into their messed up roles. Some of the storytelling is a bit vague or lazy (a telling if you will); I found myself leaving with a couple more questions regarding histories of the family and other characters. However for what it is the audience gets the just of it.Alas the ending is not as surprising as promised - although I can't fault it there, it is tough to create something audiences haven't seen before at this stage in the game ;).All in all I enjoyed this film and did not feel led astray by the trailer or advertising - it very much is what it is selling.

Review title: Ready or Not? Yes I'm READY!!
Review_body: When I first saw this trailer I thought a interesting idea about a horror movie theme around hide and seek. First thought in my head it wouldn't work because there alot of horror movie that are bad when it based on a game like truth or dare. Overall this movie works and its self aware. Grace our main character is a common horror character type but ends up as a strong lead. She run away from danger but starts to fight back knowing she got a 50/50 chance of leaving. The family of Andy steal the movie completely. Everyone brings something comedic to the film. Not all jokes land and a tiny bit of bad writing. Still I loved this movie. Its better then Crawl which is a normal B horror film. Loved it too, I seen every horror film this year except for midsummer. But if you love a fun horror film I highly recommend watching. If you have AMC A-LIST definitely watch it. Right now this is my favorite horror film of the year.

Review title: Great movie if you know what you're watching.
Review_body: Thought it was great. I see a lot of negative reviews from people talking about how it wasnt scary enough or it was poor writing. I'm just a normal guy who likes seeing a lot of movies when they come out. Some are good, some are bad, and a few are great. This one was definitely in my "great" category.From the trailer, you could easily realize that this movie wasnt a straight horror or thriller, for the people who are upset about that. And the movie itself recognizes what it is from early on: a fun, campy, comedy/thriller that tries to keep you entertained for 95 minutes (which it does). Of course there's some over-the-top deaths and gore, the movie is doing this intentionally, and I thought it worked great (especially the last 20 minutes or so).Personally, it reminded me a little bit of Cabin In The Woods, which is a great compliment because I loved that movie as well. If you want a movie with a few laughs, a few scares and tense moments, and a few good twists towards the end, go grab some tickets and see Ready or Not.And by the way, Samara Weaving did a GREAT job as the lead.
